(HEMIOPTICA) </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Hemioptica</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Roger, 1862a: 238.
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Hemioptica scissa</i>, by
monotypy. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Hemioptica</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Formicinae: Mayr, 1862: 769 [Formicidae]; Mayr, 1865: 6
[Formicidae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Hemioptica</span></i><span lang=EN-GB> in
Camponotinae: Dalla Torre, 1893: 271.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Hemioptica</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Camponotinae, Camponotini: Emery, 1895j: 772; Wheeler, W.M.
1910g: 144; all subsequent authors except the following.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Hemioptica</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Camponotinae, Polyrhachidini: Ashmead, 1905b: 384.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Hemioptica</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of Polyrhachis: Forel, 1878: 368.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Hemioptica</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Myrma</i>:
Wheeler, W.M. 1911c: 860; Wheeler, W.M. 1911f: 164.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Hemioptica</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as genus: Roger, 1862a: 238; Mayr, 1862: 769; Mayr, 1865: 6; Dalla
Torre, 1893: 271; Emery, 1895j: 772; Ashmead, 1905b: 384; Wheeler, W.M. 1910g:
144; Emery, 1925b: 209; Donisthorpe, 1943f: 649; Chapman &amp; Capco, 1951:
255. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Hemioptica</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis</i>:
Mayr, 1872: 138; Forel, 1915b: 107; Forel, 1917: 251; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 701;
Dorow &amp; Kohout, 1995: 95; Bolton, 1995b: 31; Dorow, 1995: 29. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Subgenus <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>POLYRHACHIS
(HAGIOMYRMA)</span></i> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Hagiomyrma</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Wheeler, W.M. 1911c: 860
[as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis</i>].
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica ammon</i>, by
original designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Hagiomyrma</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis</i>:
Wheeler, W.M. 1911c: 860; Forel, 1917: 251; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 702; Emery,
1925b: 184; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Subgenus <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>POLYRHACHIS (HIRTOMYRMA)</span></i>
<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Hirtomyrma</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Kohout, 2010: 199 [as
subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis</i>].
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis hirta</i>, by
original designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Hirtomyrma</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis</i>:
Kohout, 2010: 199.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Subgenus <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>POLYRHACHIS
(CAMPOMYRMA) </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Campomyrma</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Wheeler, W.M. 1911g: 860
[as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis</i>].
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis clypeata </i>(junior
synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica exercita</i>), by
original designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Campomyrma</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis</i>:
Forel, 1917: 251; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 702; Emery, 1925b: 178; all subsequent
authors. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Subgenus <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>POLYRHACHIS
(MYRMOTHRINAX)</span></i> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Myrmothrinax</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Forel, 1915b: 107 [as
subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis</i>].
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis thrinax</i>, by
original designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Myrmothrinax</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis</i>:
Forel, 1915b: 107; Forel, 1917: 251; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 704; Emery, 1925b:
178; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;</span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Junior synonym of <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>POLYRHACHIS
(MYRMOTHRINAX)</span></i> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Evelyna</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Donisthorpe, 1937c: 273 [as
subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis</i>].
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis (Evelyna)
cheesmanae</i>, by original designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Evelyna</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Myrmothrinax</i>:
Hung, 1967b: 402.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Subgenus <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>POLYRHACHIS
(CYRTOMYRMA)</span></i> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cyrtomyrma</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Forel, 1915b: 107 [as
subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis</i>].
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica rastellata</i>, by
original designation.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cyrtomyrma</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis</i>:
Forel, 1915b: 107; Forel, 1917: 251; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 701; Emery, 1925b:
207; all subsequent authors. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Subgenus <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>POLYRHACHIS
(MYRMHOPLA)</span></i> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Myrmhopla</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Forel, 1915b: 107 [as
subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis</i>].
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica armata</i>, by
original designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Myrmhopla</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis</i>:
Forel, 1915b: 107; Forel, 1917: 251; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 701; Emery, 1925b:
190; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

lang=EN-GB><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;</span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

(MYRMHOPLA)<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cephalomyrma</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Karavaiev, 1935a: 115
[as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis</i>].
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis (Cephalomyrma)
stylifera</i>, by monotypy. </span></p>

Hung, 1967b: 402.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='color:red'>Polyrhachis</span></i> references <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Smith, F. 1858b:
58 (diagnosis); Roger, 1863b: 6 (catalogue); Mayr, 1863: 422, 443 (<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Hemioptica, Polyrhachis </i>catalogues);
Mayr, 1865: 6 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis, Hemioptica</i>
diagnoses); Mayr, 1867a: 40, 41 (diagnosis, species groups (as
&quot;turmae&quot;)); Mayr, 1876: 68 (Australia species key); Forel, 1878: 368
(diagnosis); Mayr, 1879: 648 (species groups); André, 1887: 286 (Afrotropical
species key); Dalla Torre, 1893: 257, 271 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Polyrhachis,
Hemioptica</i> catalogues); Forel, 1893c: 17 (India &amp; Sri Lanka species
key); Emery, 1896d: 378 (catalogue); Emery, 1897d: 579, 582 (<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P. relucens</i> &amp; <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>P. guerini</i> groups, keys); Emery, 1898a: 227 (additions to 1896a
catalogue); Bingham, 1903: 383 (India, Sri Lanka &amp; Burma species key);
Santschi, 1910h: 284 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P. rastellata</i>
group, key); Viehmeyer, 1914b: 50, 54 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P.
rastellata</i> &amp; <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P. hostilis</i>
groups, keys); Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 256, 701, 992 (diagnosis, subgenera key,
Afrotropical catalogue); Arnold, 1924: 741 (diagnosis, South Africa species
key); Emery, 1925b: 175 (diagnosis, subgenera key, catalogue); Emery, 1925b:
178 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P. (Campomyrma)</i> diagnosis,
catalogue); Emery, 1925b: 180 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P.
(Myrmatopa)</i> diagnosis, catalogue); Emery, 1925b: 181 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>P. (Polyrhachis)</i> diagnosis, catalogue); Emery, 1925b: 182 (<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P. (Myrmothrinax)</i> diagnosis, catalogue);
Emery, 1925b: 184 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P. (Hagiomyrma)</i>
diagnosis, catalogue); Emery, 1925b: 185 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P.
(Chariomyrma)</i> diagnosis, catalogue); Emery, 1925b: 188 (<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P. (Dolichorhachis)</i> diagnosis,
catalogue); Emery, 1925b: 189 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P.
(Hedomyrma)</i> diagnosis, catalogue); Emery, 1925b: 190 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>P. (Myrmhopla)</i> diagnosis, catalogue); Emery, 1925b: 197 (<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P. (Aulacomyrma)</i> diagnosis, catalogue);
Emery, 1925b: 198 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P. (Myrma)</i>
diagnosis, catalogue); Emery, 1925b: 206 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P.
(Pseudocyrtomyrma) </i>diagnosis, catalogue); Emery, 1925b: 207 (<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P. (Cyrtomyrma)</i> diagnosis, catalogue);
Emery, 1925b: 209 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Hemioptica</i>
diagnosis, catalogue); Donisthorpe, 1938c: 246 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>P. (Cyrtomyrma)</i> review); Santschi, 1939c: 13 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>P. (Pseudocyrtomyrma)</i> species key); Chapman &amp; Capco, 1951: 186,
255, 256 (Asia <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Irenea, Hemioptica,
Polyrhachis</i> checklists); Hung, 1962: 24 (Taiwan species key); Hung, 1967b:
395 (review of subgenera); Hung, 1970: 5 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P.
(Polyrhachis)</i> species revision, key); Bolton, 1973b: 289 (Afrotropical
species revision, key); Bolton, 1975c: 1 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P.
sexspinosa</i> group, key); Taylor &amp; Brown, D.R. 1985: 131 (Australia
catalogue); Taylor, 1987a: 59 (Australia, New Caledonia checklist); Kohout,
1987: 169 (Philippines <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P. sexspinosa</i>
group, key); Kohout, 1989: 515 (Australia <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P.
relucens</i> group, key); Kohout, 1990: 500 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:

(Australia checklist); Morisita, Kubota, Onoyama, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Pseudocamponotus</i>
Carpenter, 1930: 22. Type-species: *<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Pseudocamponotus
elkoanus</i>, by original designation.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

lang=EN-GB>Formicini as group name: Latreille, 1809: 124 [Formicariae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>[<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Bajcaridris</i> Agosti, 1991:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'><span style='color:red'>CATAGLYPHIS</span></i> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cataglyphis</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Foerster, 1850b: 493.
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cataglyphis fairmairei</i>
(junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica bicolor</i>),
by monotypy. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cataglyphis</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Formicinae: Mayr, 1861: 44 [Formicidae]; Mayr, 1862: 653 (in
key) [Formicidae]; Mayr, 1865: 8 [Formicidae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cataglyphis</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Camponotinae, Formicini: Wheeler, W.M. 1910g: 144; Forel, 1912i:
89; Forel, 1917: 250.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cataglyphis</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Formicinae, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica</i>
genus group: Agosti, 1991: 295.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cataglyphis</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Formicinae, Formicini: Bondroit, 1918: 38; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a:
699; Emery, 1925b: 261; Agosti, 1994a: 93; Bolton, 1994: 50; all subsequent
authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cataglyphis</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Myrmecocystus</i>:
Forel, 1878: 372; Emery &amp; Forel, 1879a: 449; André, 1882b: 165; Forel,
1886f: 201; Mayr, 1886d: 424; Dalla Torre, 1893: 216; Bingham, 1903: 312;
Ruzsky, 1905b: 426; Emery, 1906d: 47; Emery, 1908g: 213; Karavaiev, 1924: 301.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cataglyphis</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Myrmecocystus</i>:
Wheeler, W.M. 1910g: 144.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cataglyphis</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as genus: Foerster, 1850b: 493; Roger, 1863b: 12; Mayr, 1863: 402;
Wheeler, W.M. 1913a: 78; Emery, 1925b: 261; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='color:red'>Cataglyphis</span></i> references <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Mayr, 1861: 44
(Europe species key); Roger, 1863b: 12 (catalogue); Mayr, 1863: 402
(catalogue); Mayr, 1865: 8 (diagnosis); André, 1874: 181 (Europe species key);
Forel, 1878: 372 (diagnosis); André, 1882b: 166 (Europe &amp; Algeria species
key); Nasonov, 1889: 60 (Russia species key); Bingham, 1903: 312 (diagnosis);
Ruzsky, 1905b: 426 (Russian Empire species key); Emery, 1906d: 60 (Palaearctic
species (as <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Myrmecocystus</i>), key);
Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 699 (subgenera key); Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 945
(Afrotropical catalogue); Emery, 1925b: 260 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Paraformica</i> diagnosis, catalogue); Emery, 1925b: 261 (diagnosis,
catalogue); Emery, 1925b: 266 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>C.
(Machaeromyrma)</i> diagnosis, catalogue); Santschi, 1929b: 56 (all species
key); Menozzi, 1933b: 86 (Israel species key); Kratochvíl, 1941: 108 (Central
Europe species key); Chapman &amp; Capco, 1951: 197, 203 (Asia checklist);
Bernard, 1967: 280 (diagnosis); Tarbinsky, 1976: 197 (Kyrghyzstan species key);
Arnol'di &amp; Dlussky, 1978: 554 (former European U.S.S.R. species key); Collingwood,
1978: 92 (Iberian Peninsula species key); Agosti &amp; Collingwood, 1987b: 284
(Balkans species key); Collingwood, 1985: 284 (Saudi Arabia species key);
Agosti, 1990b: 1457 (review of genus, diagnosis, species groups key,
catalogue); Dlussky, Soyunov &amp; Zabelin, 1990: 146 (Turkmenistan species
key); Atanasov &amp; Dlussky, 1992: 292 (Bulgaria species key); Agosti, 1994a:
103 (diagnosis, review of genus); Arakelian, 1994: 103 (Armenia species key);
Bolton, 1994: 50 (synoptic classification); Bolton, 1995a: 1048 (census);
Bolton, 1995b: 135 (catalogue); Collingwood &amp; Agosti, 1996: 375 (Saudi
Arabia species key); Seifert, 1996b: 179 (Central Europe species key);
Collingwood &amp; Prince, 1998: 28 (Portugal species key); Radchenko, 1998: 502
(Asia species key); Radchenko, 2001: 885 (phylogeny); Chang &amp; He, 2002b: 62
(northwest China species key); Bolton, 2003: 126 (synopsis); Seifert, 2007: 159
(North and Central Europe species key). </span></p>

designation.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Junior synonyms of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='color:red'>FORMICA<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Formicina</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Shuckard, in Swainson
&amp; Shuckard, 1840: 172. Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica
rufa</i>, by subsequent designation of Wheeler, W.M. 1911f: 164. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>[Type-species not <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica
flava</i>, unjustified subsequent designation by Emery, 1916a: 61 (footnote);
repeated by Emery, 1916b: 239 and Wheeler, W.M. 1916k: 170.]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Formicina</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Camponotinae, Formicini: Forel, 1917: 249.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Formicina</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as genus: Emery, 1916a: 61; Emery, 1916b: 239; Forel, 1917: 249;
Bondroit, 1918: 19.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Formicina</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Lasius</i>:
Wheeler, W.M. 1916k: 172. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Formicina</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Lasius</i>:
Emery, 1925b: 226; Brown, 1973b: 180.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Formicina</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Acanthomyops</i>:
Donisthorpe, 1927b: 209.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Formicina</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica</i>:
Wheeler, W.M. 1911c: 860; Wheeler, W.M. 1911f: 164; Donisthorpe, 1943f: 646;
Agosti, 1994a: 106; Bolton, 1994: 50. [<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica</i>
and <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formicina</i> share the same
type-species, synonymy is therefore absolute.]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Neoformica</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Wheeler, W.M. 1913a: 82
[as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica</i>].
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica pallidefulva</i>,
by original designation.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>[<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Neoformica</i> also described
as new by Wheeler, W.M. 1913f: 548.]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Neoformica</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica</i>:
Wheeler, W.M. 1913a: 82; Wheeler, W.M. 1913f: 388 (in key); Forel, 1917: 250;
Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 700; Emery, 1925b: 244; Donisthorpe, 1943f: 673;
Creighton, 1950a: 543.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Neoformica</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica</i>:
Buren, 1968a: 39; Agosti, 1994a: 107.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Raptiformica</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Forel, 1913i: 361 [as
subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica</i>]. Type-species: <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica sanguinea</i>, by original
designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Raptiformica</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica</i>:
Forel, 1917: 250; Emery, 1925b: 258; Donisthorpe, 1943g: 723; Creighton, 1950a:
460.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Raptiformica</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica</i>:
Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 699 (footnote); Smith, M.R. 1951a: 860; Smith, D.R. 1979:
1448; Agosti, 1994a: 107.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Serviformica</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Forel, 1913i: 361 [as
subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica</i>]. Type-species: <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica fusca</i>, by original designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Serviformica</span></i><span

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

monotypy. </span></p>

1995b: 342 (catalogue); Kupyanskaya, 1995: 361 (Far Eastern Russia species
key); MacKay &amp; MacKay, 2002: 359 (U.S.A., New Mexico species key); Bolton,
2003: 129 (synopsis).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'><span style='color:red'>PROFORMICA</span></i> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Proformica</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Ruzsky, 1902d: 13 [as
subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica</i>]. Type-species: <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica nasuta</i>, by monotypy. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>[<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Proformica</i> also described
as new by Ruzsky, 1903bb: 303.] </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Proformica</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Formicinae, Lasiini: Ashmead, 1905b: 384.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Proformica</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Camponotinae, Formicini: Forel, 1917: 250.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Proformica</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Formicinae, Formicini: Bondroit, 1918: 40; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a:
699; Emery, 1925b: 242; all subsequent authors except the following.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Proformica</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Formicinae, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica</i>
genus group: Agosti, 1991: 295.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Proformica</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica</i>:
Ruzsky, 1902d: 13; Wheeler, W.M. 1910g: 143; Forel, 1917: 250; Wheeler, W.M.
1922a: 699; Emery, 1925b: 242; Donisthorpe, 1943f: 687; Creighton, 1950a: 457.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Proformica</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as genus: Bondroit, 1918: 40; Kuznetsov-Ugamsky, 1927b: 26;
Kuznetsov-Ugamsky, 1928a: 7; subsequent authors except the above.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='color:red'>Proformica</span></i> references <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Emery, 1925b:
242 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica (Proformica)</i> diagnosis,
catalogue); Kuznetsov-Ugamsky, 1927b: 28 (Turkestan species key);
Kuznetsov-Ugamsky, 1928a: 7 (central Asia species key); Bernard, 1967: 282
(diagnosis, Western Europe species key); Dlussky, 1969a: 231 (Russia and
contiguous countries, key); Tarbinsky, 1976: 165 (Kyrghyzstan species key);
Collingwood, 1978: 92 (Iberian Peninsula species key); Agosti &amp;
Collingwood, 1987b: 287 (Balkans species key); Atanasov &amp; Dlussky, 1992:
287 (Bulgaria species key); Agosti, 1994a: 112 (diagnosis, review of genus);
Radchenko, 1994b: 115 (South Siberia species key); Arakelian, 1994: 109
(Armenia species key); Bolton, 1994: 50 (synoptic classification); Bolton,
1995a: 1052 (census); Bolton, 1995b: 368 (catalogue); Collingwood &amp; Prince,

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>PROTOFORMICA</span></i>
<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Protoformica</i></b> Dlussky, 1967b: 83 [as subgenus of <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica</i>]. Type-species: *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica (Protoformica) proformicoides</i>,
by original designation. </span></p>

Dlussky &amp; Fedoseeva, 1988: 77; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

lang=EN-GB>: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Melophorus</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

1893: 175 (catalogue); Emery, 1925b: 10 (diagnosis, catalogue); Brown, 1955d:

catalogue); Taylor, 1987a: 37 (Australia checklist); Bolton, 1994: 50 (synoptic
classification); Bolton, 1995a: 1050 (census); Bolton, 1995b: 250 (catalogue);

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genera <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>incertae
sedis</i> in <span style='color:red'>FORMICINAE</span><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>CAMPONOTITES</span></i>
<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Camponotites</i></b> Dlussky, 1981b: 76. Type-species: *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Camponotites macropterus</i>, by monotypy. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>[It is unclear whether this was intended as a genus-group name or as
a collective group name. However, as the presentation was originally
&quot;genus *<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Camponotites</i>&quot;, the
former is accepted: Bolton, 1995b: 23.]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Camponotites incertae sedis</i>
in Formicidae: Hölldobler &amp; Wilson, 1990: 18; Dlussky &amp; Rasnitsyn,
2002: 418.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Camponotites</i> in
Formicinae, Camponotini: Bolton, 1994: 50; Bolton, 1995b: 83; Bolton, 2003:
112.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>DRYMOMYRMEX</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Drymomyrmex</i></b> Wheeler, W.M. 1915h: 135. Type-species: *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Drymomyrmex fuscipennis</i>, by original
designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>[This name is sometimes misspelled as *<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Dryomyrmex</i>, for example in Donisthorpe, 1920: 93 and Wheeler, W.M.
1929a: 12.]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Drymomyrmex</i> in
Camponotinae, Camponotini: Wheeler, W.M. 1915h: 135.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Drymomyrmex</i> in
Formicinae, Brachymyrmecini: Wheeler, W.M. 1929a: 12. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Drymomyrmex</i> in
Formicinae, Camponotini: Donisthorpe, 1943f: 641; Dlussky &amp; Fedoseeva,
1988: 77; Bolton, 1994: 50.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Drymomyrmex</i> as junior
synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Camponotus</i>: Dlussky, 1997:
623; Bolton, 2003: 112.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Drymomyrmex</i> revived from
synonymy: Dlussky &amp; Rasnitsyn, 2009: 1036 (by implication <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>incertae sedis</i> in Formicinae).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>IMHOFFIA</span></i> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span

normal'>Imhoffia</i></b> Heer, 1850: 153. Type-species: *<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:

lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>MAGNOGASTERITES</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Magnogasterites</i></b> Hong, 2002: 592. Type-species: *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Magnogasterites curticornutus</i>, by
original designation.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Magnogasterites</i> in
Formicinae: Hong, 2002: 592.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>ORBICAPITIA</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Orbicapitia</i></b> Hong, 2002: 601. Type-species: *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Orbicapitia reticulata</i>, by original
designation.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Orbicapitia</i> in
Formicinae: Hong, 2002: 601.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>OVALICAPITO</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Ovalicapito</i></b> Hong, 2002: 596. Type-species: *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Ovalicapito fushunensis</i>, by original
designation.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Ovalicapito</i> in
Formicinae: Hong, 2002: 596.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>OVALIGASTRULA</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Ovaligastrula</i></b> Hong, 2002: 599. Type-species: *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Ovaligastrula xilutianensis</i>, by original
designation.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Ovaligastrula</i> in
Formicinae: Hong, 2002: 599.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>SINOFORMICA</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Sinoformica</i></b><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'> </i>Hong,
2002: 619. Type-species: *<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Sinoformica
longicapitata</i>, by original designation.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Sinoformica </i>in
Formicinae: Hong, 2002: 619.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>SINOTENUICAPITO</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Sinotenuicapito</i></b> Hong, 2002: 587. Type-species: *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Sinotenuicapito badis</i>, by original
designation.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Sinotenuicapito</i> in
Formicinae: Hong, 2002: 587. [BB note: probably Dolichoderinae.]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>WILSONIA</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Wilsonia</i></b> Hong, 2002: 608. Type-species: *<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Wilsonia megagastrosa</i>, by original designation.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>[*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Wilsonia</i> Hong, 2002, unresolved
junior homonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Wilsonia</i> Bonaparte,
1838 “List Birds Eur. Amer., 23” (Aves); reference from <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Nomenclator Zoologicus</i>, not yet seen.]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Wilsonia</i> in Formicinae:
Hong, 2002: 608.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

</div>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>THE MYRMECIOMORPHS: SUBFAMILIES MYRMECIINAE AND
PSEUDOMYRMECINAE<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>SUBFAMILY <span style='color:red'>MYRMECIINAE</span><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Subfamily <span
style='color:red'>MYRMECIINAE</span> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Myrmeciidae</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Emery, 1877a: 71. Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Myrmecia</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Myrmeciinae as group of Myrmicidae: Emery, 1877a: 71 [Myrmeciidae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Myrmeciinae as subfamily of Poneridae: Ashmead, 1905b: 382.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Myrmeciinae as subfamily of Formicidae: Clark, 1951: 17; Brown,
1954e: 22; all subsequent authors. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Myrmeciinae as
myrmeciomorph subfamily of Formicidae: Bolton, 2003: 29, 132.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Myrmeciinae as formicoid subfamily of Formicidae: Brady, Schultz, <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 18173; Moreau, Bell, <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 102.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Myrmeciinae as
formicoid myrmeciomorph subfamily of Formicidae: Ward, 2007a: 556.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Tribes of Myrmeciinae: Myrmeciini, Prionomyrmecini.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genera (extinct<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>) incertae sedis</i> in Myrmeciinae</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB>: *<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Archimyrmex, *Avitomyrmex,
*Macabeemyrma, *Ypresiomyrma</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Collective group name in
Myrmeciinae</span></b><span lang=EN-GB>: *<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Myrmeciites</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe <span
style='color:red'>MYRMECIINI</span><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Myrmeciidae</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Emery, 1877a: 71. Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Myrmecia</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Myrmeciini as tribe of Ponerinae: Forel, 1893a: 162 [Myrmecii];
Emery, 1895j: 766 [Myrmecii]; Emery, 1901a: 36 [Myrmecii]; Wheeler, W.M. 1910g:
134 [Myrmecii]; Emery, 1911d: 17; Forel, 1917: 235; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 636,
640; subsequent authors to the following. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Myrmeciini as
tribe of Myrmeciinae: Brown, 1954e: 23; all subsequent authors. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus of Myrmeciini</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB>: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Myrmecia</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Subfamily, tribe and genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'><span style='color:red'>Myrmecia</span></i> references <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Smith, F. 1858b:
143 (diagnosis); Roger, 1863b: 22 (catalogue); Mayr, 1862: 723 (all species
key); Mayr, 1863: 429 (catalogue); Mayr, 1865: 18 (diagnosis); Forel, 1893a:
162 (diagnosis); Dalla Torre, 1893: 19 (catalogue); Emery, 1895j: 766
(diagnosis); Wheeler, W.M. 1910g: 134 (diagnosis); Emery, 1911d: 17 (diagnosis,
subgenera key, catalogue); Forel, 1917: 235 (synoptic classification); Clark,
1943: 85 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Promyrmecia</i> species key);
Clark, 1951: 21, 119 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Myrmecia,
Promyrmecia</i> species revisions, keys); Brown, 1953j: 1 (revisionary notes);
Brown, 1954e: 22 (diagnosis, phylogeny); Eisner, 1957: 449 (proventriculus
morphology); Brown, 1958h: 10 (New Zealand); Gotwald, 1969: 113 (mouthparts
morphology); Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1972a: 38 (diagnosis); Brown,
1973b: 165 (genera, distribution); Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1976b: 46
(larvae, review &amp; synthesis); Greenslade, 1979: 11 (South Australia,
review); Kugler, C. 1980b: 263 (sting structure); Taylor &amp; Brown, D.R.
1985: 6 (Australia catalogue); Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1985: 256
(synoptic classification); Billen, 1986: 170 (Dufour's gland); Taylor, 1987a:
41 (Australia, New Caledonia &amp; New Zealand checklists); Dlussky &amp;
Fedoseeva, 1988: 77 (synoptic classification); Billen, 1988: 27 (comparison of
genera); Billen, 1990: 133 (sting bulb gland); Ogata, 1991a: 353 (species
groups review, phylogeny); Ogata &amp; Taylor, 1991d: 1623 (all species review,
key); Brandão, 1991: 390 (Neotropical *fauna, synoptic classification); Baroni
Urbani, Bolton &amp; Ward, 1992: 317 (phylogeny); Bolton, 1994: 73 (diagnosis,
synoptic classification); Bolton, 1995a: 1050 (census); Bolton, 1995b: 270
(catalogue); Shattuck, 1999: 119 (Australia, synopsis); Baroni Urbani, 2000:
480 (phylogeny); Dlussky &amp; Rasnitsyn, 2002: 418 (*fossil taxa, diagnosis
for impression fossils); Ward &amp; Brady, 2003: 361 (phylogeny,
classification); Bolton, 2003: 29, 131 (diagnosis, synopsis); Brady, Schultz, <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 18173 (phylogeny); Moreau,
Bell, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 102 (phylogeny);
Archibald, Cover &amp; Moreau, 2006: 505 (*fossil taxa, morphology,
systematics, discussion).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus of <span
style='color:red'>Myrmeciini</span><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'><span style='color:red'>MYRMECIA</span></i> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Myrmecia</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Fabricius, 1804: 423.
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica gulosa</i>, by
subsequent designation of Shuckard, in Swainson &amp; Shuckard, 1840: 173. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Myrmecia</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Poneridae, Myrmicidae: Smith, F. 1858b: 143.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Myrmecia</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae: Mayr, 1865: 18 [Myrmicidae]; Mayr, 1866b: 896
[Myrmicidae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Myrmecia</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicidae, Myrmeciidae: Emery, 1877a: 81.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Myrmecia</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Ponerinae: Mayr, 1862: 714 [Poneridae]; Dalla Torre, 1893: 19.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Myrmecia</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Poneridae, Myrmeciinae: Ashmead, 1905b: 382.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Myrmecia</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Ponerinae, Myrmeciini: Forel, 1893a: 162 [Myrmecii]; Emery,
1895j: 766 [Myrmecii]; Wheeler, W.M. 1910g: 134 [Myrmecii]; Emery, 1911d: 17;
Forel, 1917: 235; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 640; Clark, 1934c: 50; Donisthorpe,
1943f: 665.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Myrmecia</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmeciinae: Clark, 1951: 16 (in key); Brown, 1954e: 23; all
subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Junior synonyms of <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>MYRMECIA<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Promyrmecia</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Emery, 1911d: 19 [as
subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Myrmecia</i>]. Type-species: <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Myrmecia aberrans</i>, by original
designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Promyrmecia</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Myrmecia</i>:
Forel, 1917: 235; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 640; Clark, 1927: 37; Donisthorpe,
1943f: 688.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Promyrmecia</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as genus: Clark, 1943: 84; Clark, 1951: 119. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Promyrmecia</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Myrmecia</i>:
Brown, 1953j: 1; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Pristomyrmecia</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Emery, 1911d: 21 [as
subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Myrmecia</i>]. Type-species: <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Myrmecia mandibularis</i>, by original
designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i

lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Myrmecia</i>:
Emery, 1911d: 21; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 640.</span></p>

Clark, 1927: 37; Clark, 1943: 84; Clark, 1951: 119. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

lang=EN-GB>Nothomyrmecii as subfamily of Formicidae: Clark, 1951: 16 (in key)

lang=EN-GB> as genus: all authors except the two Baroni Urbani entries above.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='color:red'>Nothomyrmecia</span></i> references<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Brown &amp;
Wilson, 1959a: 25 (historical); Taylor, 1978a: 979 (revision, anatomy,
phylogeny); Greenslade, 1979: 13 (South Australia, review); Kugler, C. 1980b:
263 (sting structure); Wheeler, G.C, Wheeler, J. &amp; Taylor, 1980: 131
(larva); Taylor &amp; Brown, D.R. 1985: 5 (Australia, catalogue); Billen, 1988:
27 (comparison of genera); Billen, 1990: 133 (sting bulb gland); Baroni Urbani,
Bolton &amp; Ward, 1992: 317 (phylogeny); Bolton, 1994: 152 (diagnosis,
synoptic classification); Bolton, 1995a: 1042 (census); Bolton, 1995b: 13, 292
(catalogue); Shattuck, 1999: 58, 177 (Australia, synopsis); Baroni Urbani,
2000: 478 (diagnosis, phylogeny); Bolton, 2003: 133 (synopsis); Ward &amp;
Brady, 2003: 375 (phylogeny, classification); Baroni Urbani, 2005: 591
(phylogeny, classification).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>PRIONOMYRMEX</span></i>
<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Prionomyrmex</i></b> Mayr, 1868c: 77. Type-species: *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Prionomyrmex longiceps</i>, by monotypy. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Prionomyrmex</i> in Myrmicidae,
Myrmeciidae: Emery, 1877a: 81.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Prionomyrmex</i> in
Ponerinae: Mayr, 1868c: 77 [Poneridae]; Dalla Torre, 1893: 22.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Prionomyrmex</i> in
Ponerinae, Prionomyrmecini: Wheeler, 1915e: 25.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Prionomyrmex</i> in
Myrmeciinae, Prionomyrmecini: Brown, 1954e: 22; Bolton, 1994: 73; Ward &amp;
Brady, 2003: 375; Bolton, 2003: 133.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Prionomyrmex</i> in
Prionomyrmecinae: Baroni Urbani, 2000: 479; Baroni Urbani, 2005: 590.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;</span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus *<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span

2000: 478 (diagnosis, revision, phylogeny); Dlussky &amp; Rasnitsyn, 2002: 418
(*fossil taxa, notes); Ward &amp; Brady, 2003: 375 (phylogeny, classification).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

sedis</i> in <span style='color:red'>MYRMECIINAE</span><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:center;
text-indent:-.5in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>SUBFAMILY
<span style='color:red'>PSEUDOMYRMECINAE</span><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Subfamily <span
style='color:red'>PSEUDOMYRMECINAE</span> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Pseudomyrmecinae</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Smith, M.R. 1952a: 98. Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Pseudomyrmex</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Pseudomyrmecinae as family: Bernard, 1953b: 221 [Pseudomyrmicidae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Pseudomyrmecinae as subfamily of Formicidae: Smith, M.R. 1952a: 98;
Brown, 1954e: 23; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Pseudomyrmecinae as myrmeciomorph subfamily of Formicidae: Bolton,
2003: 30, 134.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Pseudomyrmecinae as formicoid subfamily of Formicidae: Brady,
Schultz, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 18173; Moreau,
Bell, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 102.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Pseudomyrmecinae as formicoid myrmeciomorph subfamily of Formicidae:
Ward, 2007a: 556.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB>: Pseudomyrmecini.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe <span
style='color:red'>PSEUDOMYRMECINI</span><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Pseudomyrmecinae</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Smith, M.R. 1952a: 98. Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Pseudomyrmex</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Pseudomyrmecini as tribe of Pseudomyrmecinae: Bolton, 1994: 185.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Junior synonyms of <span
style='color:red'>PSEUDOMYRMECINI<o:p></o:p></span></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Pseudomyrmidae</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Forel, 1885a: 377. Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Pseudomyrma</i>
(junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Pseudomyrmex</i>).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Pseudomyrmidae as tribe of Myrmicinae: Forel, 1885a: 377
[Pseudomyrmidae]; Forel, 1893a: 164 [Pseudomyrmii]; Forel, 1895b: 121
[Pseudomyrmii]; Emery, 1895j: 768 [Pseudomyrmii (subfamily spelled Myrmicini)];
Forel, 1899c: 86 [Pseudomyrmii]; Wheeler, W.M. 1910g: 139 [Pseudomyrmii];
Forel, 1899c: 86 [Pseudomyrmini]; Emery, 1914a: 34 [Pseudomyrmini]; Wheeler,
W.M. 1915h: 40 [Pseudomyrmini]; Arnold, 1916: 173 [Pseudomyrmini]; Forel, 1917:
240 [Pseudomyrmini]; Emery, 1921f: 21 [Pseudomyrmini].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Pseudomyrmidae as subfamily of Myrmicidae: Emery, 1894g: 383
[Pseudomyrminae]; Ashmead, 1905b: 383 [Pseudomyrminae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Pseudomyrmidae as subfamily of Formicidae: Emery, 1899c: 8
[Pseudomyrminae]; Wheeler, W.M. 1920: 53 [Pseudomyrminae]; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a:
103, 632 [Pseudomyrminae]; Donisthorpe, 1922: xli [Pseudomyrminae]; Creighton,
1950a: 77 [Pseudomyrminae]; Chapman &amp; Capco, 1951: 78 [Pseudomyrminae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Pseudomyrmidae as junior synonym of Pseudomyrmecinae: Ward, 1990: 459.
[Pseudomyrmecinae retains priority over Pseudomyrmidae under Article 40.2 of
the International Code of Zoological Nomenclature (4th Edition), 1999: 46.]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Leptaleinae</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Smith, M.R. 1951a: 788. Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Leptalea</i> (junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Pseudomyrmex</i>).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Leptaleinae as subfamily of Formicidae: Smith, M.R. 1951a: 788.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Leptaleinae as junior synonym of Pseudomyrmecinae: Smith, M.R.
1958c: 112; all subsequent authors. [Pseudomyrmecinae retains priority over
Leptaleinae under Article 40.2 of the International Code of Zoological
Nomenclature (4th Edition), 1999: 46.]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genera of Pseudomyrmecini</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB>: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Myrcidris, Pseudomyrmex,
Tetraponera</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Subfamily and tribe <span style='color:red'>Pseudomyrmecini</span>
references <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

(diagnosis); Emery, 1914a: 34 (diagnosis, in key); Emery, 1921f: 21 (diagnosis,

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Myrcidris epicharis</i>, by
original designation.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

lang=EN-GB> in Pseudomyrmecinae: Ward, 1990: 465; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

lang=EN-GB>[<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:purple'>Leptalaea</span></i>
Spinola, 1851b: 52 and Spinola, 1853: 68, incorrect subsequent spellings.]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>[<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Pseudomyrmex</i> and <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Leptalea</i> share the same type-species;
synonymy is therefore absolute.]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
