<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Latinoda</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Pseudomyrmex</i>:
Ward, 1990: 469.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='color:red'>Pseudomyrmex</span></i> references <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Smith, F. 1858b:
153 (diagnosis); Roger, 1863b: 24 (catalogue); Mayr, 1863: 426, 451 (<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Leptalea, Pseudomyrma</i> catalogues); Mayr,
1865: 24 (diagnosis); Mayr, 1870a: 407 (Colombia + Panama (= New Grenada)
species key); Smith, 1877b: 58 (checklist); Cresson, 1887: 262 (U.S.A.
catalogue); Dalla Torre, 1893: 55 (catalogue); Emery, 1921f: 28 (diagnosis,
catalogue); Gallardo, 1932a: 44 (Argentina species key); Enzmann, E.V. 1944: 62
(all species keys); Creighton, 1950a: 79 (North America species key); Kempf,
1961a: 373 (P. gracilis group, partial key); Kempf, 1972a: 215 (Neotropical
catalogue); Alayo, 1974: 9 (Cuba species key); Smith, D.R. 1979: 1345 (North
America catalogue); Ward, 1985b: 215 (Nearctic species key); Billen, 1986: 173
(Dufour's gland); Ward, 1989: 407 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P.
oculatus</i> group, key); Ward, 1989: 430 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P.
subtilissimus</i> group, key); Ward, 1990: 469 (diagnosis, review of genus);
Brandão, 1991: 373 (catalogue); Ward, 1992: 76 (*Dominican Amber species key);
Ward, 1993: 130 (swollen-thorn <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Acacia</i>-associated
species key); Bolton, 1994: 184 (synoptic classification); Bolton, 1995a: 1052
(census); Bolton, 1995b: 370 (catalogue); Ward, 1999b: 473 (<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P. viduus</i> group, and other <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Tachigali</i>- and <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Triplaris</i>-associated species key); MacKay &amp; MacKay, 2002: 38
(U.S.A., New Mexico species key).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'><span style='color:red'>TETRAPONERA</span></i> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Tetraponera</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Smith, F. 1852: 44.
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Tetraponera atrata</i>
(junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Eciton nigrum</i>), by
subsequent designation of Wheeler, W.M. 1911f: 173. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tetraponera</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Formicidae, Poneridae: Smith, F. 1857a: 70.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tetraponera</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicidae: Smith, F. 1877b: 68. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tetraponera</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Pseudomyrmini: Forel, 1917: 240; Emery, 1921f: 24.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tetraponera</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Pseudomyrminae: Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 654; subsequent authors to
the following.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tetraponera</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Pseudomyrmecinae: Taylor &amp; Brown, D.R. 1985: 17; all
subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tetraponera</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of Pseudomyrma: Roger, 1863b: 24; Mayr, 1863:
451.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tetraponera</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Sima</i>:
Dalla Torre, 1893: 53; Bingham, 1903: 107; Emery, 1917a: 95. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tetraponera</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Sima</i>:
Emery, 1900d: 673; Emery, 1915b: 266; Arnold, 1916: 180; Forel, 1917: 240;
Emery, 1921f: 24. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tetraponera</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as genus: Smith, F. 1852: 44; Smith, F. 1857a: 70; Smith, F. 1877b:
68; Donisthorpe, 1916b: 244; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 654; Taylor &amp; Brown, D.R.
1985: 17; Ward, 1990: 470; Bolton, 1994: 184.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Junior synonyms of <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>TETRAPONERA<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Sima</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Roger, 1863a: 178.
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Sima compressa</i> (junior
synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Pseudomyrma allaborans</i>),
by monotypy. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>[Type-species not <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Eciton
rufonigrum</i>, unjustified subsequent designation by Emery, 1915b: 266,
repeated in Emery, 1917a: 95 and Emery, 1921f: 22.] </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Sima</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicidae: Smith, F. 1871a: 328.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Sima</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicidae, Myrmeciidae: Emery, 1877a: 81.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Sima</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae: Mayr, 1865: 25 [Myrmicidae]; Mayr, 1866b: 906
[Myrmicidae]; Dalla Torre, 1893: 53.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Sima</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicidae, Pseudomyrminae: Ashmead, 1905b: 383.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Sima</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Pseudomyrmini: Forel, 1893a: 164; Emery, 1895j: 768;
Emery, 1914a: 40; Forel, 1917: 240; Wheeler, W.M. 1915h: 40; Arnold, 1916: 173;
Emery, 1921f: 21.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Sima</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as genus: Roger, 1863a: 178; Mayr, 1863: 453; Mayr, 1868c: 100;
Dalla Torre, 1893: 53; Emery, 1900d: 672; Bingham, 1903: 107; Emery, 1914a: 40;
Emery, 1915b: 266; Arnold, 1916: 173; Emery, 1917a: 95; Forel, 1917: 240;
Emery, 1921f: 21.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Sima</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Tetraponera</i>:
Smith, F. 1877b: 68; Donisthorpe, 1916b: 244; Wheeler, W.M. 1920: 47; Wheeler,
W.M. 1922a: 105; Donisthorpe, 1943g: 726; Ward, 1990: 470.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Pachysima</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Emery, 1912b: 97 [as
subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Sima</i>]. Type-species: <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Tetraponera aethiops</i>, by monotypy. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Pachysima</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Pseudomyrmini: Forel, 1917: 240; Emery, 1921f: 22.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Pachysima</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Pseudomyrminae: Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 112, 654.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Pachysima</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as genus: Wheeler, W.M. 1918c: 308 (footnote); Wheeler, W.M. 1922a:
112, 654.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Pachysima</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Sima</i>:
Emery, 1912b: 97; Arnold, 1916: 174; Emery, 1921f: 22.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Pachysima</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Tetraponera</i>:
Brown, 1973b: 183 [provisional]; Ward, 1990: 470.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Viticicola</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Wheeler, W.M. 1919i: 130
(in text). Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Sima tessmanni</i>,
by original designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>[<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Viticicola</i> also as new in
Wheeler, W.M. 1920: 53.]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Viticicola</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Pseudomyrminae: Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 107, 654.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Viticicola</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Tetraponera</i>:
Brown, 1973b: 185 [provisional]; Ward, 1990: 470.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>[<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:purple'>Viticola</span></i>
Donisthorpe, 1943g: 735, incorrect subsequent spelling.]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Parasima</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Donisthorpe, 1948d: 592 [as
subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Tetraponera</i>].
[Unnecessary replacement name for <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Sima</i>
in the sense of Emery, 1921f: 23.] </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Parasima</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Tetraponera</i>:
Ward, 1990: 470.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='color:red'>Tetraponera</span></i> references <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Mayr, 1863: 453
(catalogue); Mayr, 1865: 25 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Sima</i>
diagnosis); Mayr, 1867a: 82 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Sima</i>
diagnosis); Mayr, 1868c: 101 (*Baltic Amber species key); Smith, F. 1877b: 68
(checklist); Dalla Torre, 1893: 53 (catalogue); Emery, 1900d: 17 (Asia &amp;
Australia species key); Forel, 1903a: 708 (India &amp; Sri Lanka species key);
Bingham, 1903: 107 (India, Sri Lanka &amp; Burma species key); Arnold, 1916:
173 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Sima</i> diagnosis, South Africa
species key); Emery, 1921f: 21 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Sima</i>
diagnosis, subgenera key, catalogue); Emery, 1921f: 22 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>S. (Pachysima) </i>diagnosis, catalogue); Emery, 1921f: 24 (<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>S. (Tetraponera)</i> diagnosis, catalogue);
Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 112 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Pachysima</i>
species key); Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 104, 107, 112 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Tetraponera, Viticicola, Pachysima</i> diagnoses); Wheeler, W.M. 1922a:
795, 801 (Afrotropical <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Tetraponera,
Viticicola, Pachysima</i> catalogues); Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 1014 (Malagasy
catalogue); Taylor &amp; Brown, D.R. 1985: 17 (Australia catalogue); Taylor,
1987a: 79 (Australia checklist); Wu, J. &amp; Wang, 1990: 516 (China species
key); Dlussky &amp; Radchenko, 1990: 120 (Vietnam species key); Ward, 1990: 470
(diagnosis, review of genus, phylogeny); Bolton, 1994: 184 (synoptic
classification); Bolton, 1995a: 1053 (census); Bolton, 1995b: 416 (catalogue);
Wu, J. &amp; Wang, 1995: 55 (China species key); Collingwood &amp; Agosti,
1996: 312 (Saudi Arabia species key); Shattuck, 1999: 208 (Australia synopsis);
Zhou, 2001b: 64 (China, Guangxi species key); Ward, 2001: 596 (Oriental &amp;
Australian, all species, revision, key); Xu &amp; Chai, 2004: 64 (China species
key); Ward, 2006: 120 (Afrotropical species groups key); Ward, 2006: 123 (<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>T. ambigua</i> group, key); Ward, 2009: 288
(<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>T. grandidieri</i> group, key); Dlussky,
2009: 1084 (Eocene amber species key); Terayama, 2009: 128 (Taiwan species key).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

</div>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>THE DORYLOMORPHS: SUBFAMILIES AENICTINAE,
AENICTOGITONINAE, CERAPACHYINAE, DORYLINAE, ECITONINAE AND LEPTANILLOIDINAE<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;
margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:center;
text-indent:-.5in;tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>SUBFAMILY <span style='color:red'>CERAPACHYINAE</span><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Subfamily <span
style='color:red'>CERAPACHYINAE</span> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cerapachysii</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Forel, 1893a: 162. Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cerapachys</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cerapachyinae as family: Bernard, 1951: 1046 [Cerapachyidae];
Bernard, 1953b: 215 [Cerapachyidae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB>Cerapachyinae as junior synonym of
Ponerinae: Brown, 1975: 14; Snelling, 1981: 387; Hölldobler &amp; Wilson, 1990:
10. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Cerapachyinae as
group of Dorylinae: Emery, 1901a: 36 [Cerapachinae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cerapachyinae as subfamily of Formicidae: Wheeler, W.M. 1902d: 185;
Wheeler, W.M. 1920: 53; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 51, 632; Donisthorpe, 1922: xlv;
Borgmeier, 1923: 50; Clark, 1924b: 76; Clark, 1934c: 49; Donisthorpe, 1943f:
620; Creighton, 1950a: 56; Clark, 1951: 15 (in key); Chapman &amp; Capco, 1951:
17; Smith, M.R. 1951a: 781; Brown, 1954e: 26; Kusnezov, 1956: 11; Kusnezov,
1964: 48; Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1972a: 37; Kempf, 1972a: 263; Wheeler,
G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1976b: 46; Smith, D.R. 1979: 1333; Wheeler, G.C. &amp;
Wheeler, J. 1985: 256; Ogata, 1987: 127; Bolton, 1990a: 66; Bolton, 1990c:
1356; Baroni Urbani, Bolton &amp; Ward, 1992: 316; Jaffe, 1993: 9; Bolton,
1994: 18; Wu, J. &amp; Wang, 1995: 47. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cerapachyinae as dorylomorph subfamily of Formicidae: Bolton, 2003:
32, 137; Brady &amp; Ward, 2005: 593. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cerapachyinae as formicoid subfamily of Formicidae: Moreau, Bell, <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 102.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cerapachyinae as formicoid dorylomorph subfamily of Formicidae:
Brady, Schultz, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 18173;
Ward, 2007a: 555. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribes
of Cerapachyinae</span></b><span lang=EN-GB>: Acanthostichini, Cerapachyini,
Cylindromyrmecini.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Subfamily <span style='color:red'>Cerapachyinae</span>
references <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Emery, 1895j:
765 (diagnosis); Wheeler, W.M. 1910g: 136 (diagnosis); Emery, 1911d: 5 (tribes
key); Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 51, 636 (diagnosis, tribes key); Morley, 1939: 114
(phylogeny); Smith, M.R. 1947f: 528 (U.S.A. diagnosis, genera); Brown, 1954e:
26 (phylogeny, notes); Eisner, 1957: 476 (proventriculus morphology); Gotwald,
1969: 43 (mouthparts morphology); Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1972a: 37
(diagnosis); Kempf, 1972a: 263 (Neotropical, synoptic classification); Brown,
1975: 11 (revision of tribes and genera, diagnoses); Wheeler, G.C. &amp;
Wheeler, J. 1976b: 46 (larvae, review &amp; synthesis); Wheeler, G.C. &amp;
Wheeler, J. 1985: 261 (diagnosis); Ogata, 1987: 129 (Japan genera); Bolton,
1990a: 53 (abdominal morphology, diagnosis, synoptic classification,
zoogeography); Bolton, 1990c: 1356 (diagnosis, morphology, phylogeny); Brandão,
1991: 390 (Neotropical fauna, synoptic classification, genera); Baroni Urbani,
Bolton &amp; Ward, 1992: 316 (phylogeny); Jaffe, 1993: 7 (Neotropical genera,
synoptic classification); Lattke, in Jaffe, 1993: 165 (Neotropical genera);
Bolton, 1994: 18 (diagnosis, synoptic classification, key to genera); Bolton,
1995a: 1038 (census); Bolton, 1995b: 10 (catalogue); Hölldobler, Obermayer
&amp; Peeters, 1996: 158 (metatibial gland); Perfil’eva, 2002: 1239 (venation);
Palacio &amp; Fernández, in Fernández, 2003d: 238 (Neotropical genera keys);
Brady, 2003: 6575 (phylogeny); Bolton, 2003: 32, 137 (diagnosis, synopsis);
Brady &amp; Ward, 2005: 593 (phylogeny); Moreau, Bell, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 102 (phylogeny); Brady, Schultz, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 18173 (phylogeny); Ward, 2007a: 555 (classification). </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-right:-1.25pt;text-align:justify;tab-stops:
6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe
<span style='color:red'>ACANTHOSTICHINI</span> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Acanthostichii</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Emery, 1901a: 34. Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Acanthostichus</i>.
</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB>Acanthostichini as tribe of Dorylinae:
Emery, 1901a: 34 [Acanthostichii]; Emery, 1904a: 116 [Acanthostichii]. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB>Acanthostichini as subfamily of Dorylidae:
Ashmead, 1905b: 382 [Acanthostichinae]; Ashmead, 1906: 28 [Acanthostichinae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB>Acanthostichini as tribe of Ponerinae:
Emery, 1911d: 12; Forel, 1917: 239; Gallardo, 1918b: 6; Donisthorpe, 1943f:
619; Brown, 1975: 39; Dlussky &amp; Fedoseeva, 1988: 79; Hölldobler &amp;
Wilson, 1990: 10.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Acanthostichini as tribe of Cerapachyinae: Wheeler, W.M. 1902d: 184;
Wheeler, W.M. 1910g: 137 [subtribe of Cerapachysii]; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 640;
Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1985: 256; Bolton, 1990a: 67; Bolton, 1990c:
1357; Jaffe, 1993: 9; Bolton, 1994: 19; Bolton, 2003: 33, 137. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus
of Acanthostichini</span></b><span lang=EN-GB>: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Acanthostichus</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

Bolton, 1990a: 58 (abdominal morphology); Brandão, 1991: 322 (catalogue);
Bolton, 1995a: 1047 (census); Bolton, 1995b: 54 (catalogue); MacKay, 1996: 129

tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

townsendi</i> (junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Acanthostichus
texanus</i>), by original designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Ctenopyga</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Acanthostichus</i>:
Emery, 1911d: 13; Forel, 1917: 239; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 640; Creighton, 1950a:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Ctenopyga</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as genus: Ashmead, 1906: 29; Brown, 1975: 42; Smith, D.R. 1979:
1333; Hölldobler &amp; Wilson, 1990: 10; Bolton, 1990a: 67; Bolton, 1990c:
1357.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Ctenopyga</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Acanthostichus</i>:
Brown, 1973b: 179 [provisional]; Snelling, 1981: 389; Bolton, 1994: 19; MacKay,
1996: 132; Bolton, 2003: 138.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus
<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>Acanthostichus</span></i>
references</span></b><span lang=EN-GB>: see above.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe
<span style='color:red'>CYLINDROMYRMECINI</span> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cylindromyrmii</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Emery, 1901a: 34. Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cylindromyrmex</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB>Cylindromyrmecini as tribe of Dorylinae:
Emery, 1901a: 34 [Cylindromyrmii]; Emery, 1904a: 116 [Cylindromyrmecii]. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB>Cylindromyrmecini as tribe of
Pachycondylinae: Ashmead, 1905b: 382 [Cylindromyrmicini].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cylindromyrmecini as tribe of Ponerinae: Emery, 1911d: 14
[Cylindromyrmicini]; Arnold, 1915: 19 [Cylindromyrmicini]; Forel, 1917: 239
[Cylindromyrmicini]; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 640 [Cylindromyrmicini]; Brown, 1975:
36; Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1985: 256; Dlussky &amp; Fedoseeva, 1988:
79; Hölldobler &amp; Wilson, 1990: 10.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB>Cylindromyrmecini as tribe of Cerapachyinae:
Wheeler, W.M. 1902d: 185 [Cylindromyrmii]; Wheeler, W.M. 1910g: 137
[Cylindromyrmii, subtribe of Cerapachysii]; Brown, 1954e: 27 (in text); Bolton,
1990a: 67; Bolton, 1990c: 1357; Jaffe, 1993: 9; Bolton, 1994: 19; De Andrade,
1998a: 581; Bolton, 2003: 33, 138. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus
of Cylindromyrmecini</span></b><span lang=EN-GB>: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Cylindromyrmex</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe and genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='color:red'>Cylindromyrmex</span></i> references <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Dalla Torre,
1893: 16 (catalogue); Emery, 1911d: 14 (diagnosis, catalogue); Arnold, 1915: 19
(diagnosis); Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 640 (genera key); Wheeler, W.M. 1924a: 104 (all
species key); Menozzi, 1931d: 194 (all species key); Wheeler, W.M. 1937b: 444
(all species key); Kempf, 1972a: 91 (catalogue); Brown, 1975: 36 (diagnosis,
review of tribe and genus, key); Bolton, 1990a: 59 (abdominal morphology);
Bolton, 1995a: 1049 (census); Bolton, 1995b: 167 (catalogue); De Andrade,
1998a: 581 (diagnosis, all species revision, key); Bolton, 2003: 33, 138
(diagnosis, synopsis).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus of <span style='color:red'>Cylindromyrmecini</span><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus

<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

1870b: 967. Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cylindromyrmex
striatus</i>, by monotypy. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe
<span style='color:red'>CERAPACHYINI</span> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cerapachysii</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Forel, 1893a: 162. Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cerapachys</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB>Cerapachyini as tribe of Ponerinae: Forel,
1893a: 162 [Cerapachysii]; Forel, 1900c: 52 [Cerapachii]; Forel, 1900d: 328
[Cerapachii]; Forel, 1901c: 139 [Cerapachii]; Ashmead, 1905b: 382; Wheeler,
W.M. 1910g: 136 [Cerapachysii]; Emery, 1911d: 5; Wheeler, W.M. 1915h: 27;
Arnold, 1915: 11; Forel, 1917: 239; Wheeler, W.M. 1918a: 215; Arnold, 1926:
191; Brown, 1975: 14; Dlussky &amp; Fedoseeva, 1988: 79; Hölldobler &amp;
Wilson, 1990: 10.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB>Cerapachyini as tribe of Dorylinae: Emery,
1895j: 765 [Cerapachyi]; Emery, 1901a: 36 [Cerapachyi]; Emery, 1904a: 116
[Cerapachyi].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB>Cerapachyini as tribe of Cerapachyinae:
Wheeler, W.M. 1902d: 185 [Cerapachyi]; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 638; Wheeler, W.M.
&amp; Chapman, 1925: 50; Donisthorpe, 1943f: 620; Chapman &amp; Capco, 1951:
17; Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1985: 256; Bolton, 1990a: 67; Bolton,
1990c: 1357; Jaffe, 1993: 9; Bolton, 1994: 19; Bolton, 2003: 33, 139.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Junior
synonyms of <span style='color:red'>CERAPACHYINI<o:p></o:p></span></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Lioponerini</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Ashmead, 1905b: 382. Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Lioponera</i> (junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cerapachys</i>).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Lioponerini as
tribe of Pachycondylinae: Ashmead, 1905b: 382.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Lioponerini as junior synonym of Cerapachyini: Emery, 1911d: 6; Brown,
1975: 19 (no statement of tribe synonymy but all taxa included under <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cerapachys</i>); Bolton, 1994: 19; all
subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Eusphinctinae</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Clark, 1951: 15 (diagnosis in key). Type-genus: <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Eusphinctus</i> (junior synonym of <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Sphinctomyrmex</i>).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Eusphinctinae as
subfamily of Formicidae: Clark, 1951: 15.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Eusphinctinae as
junior synonym of Cerapachyini: Bolton, 1990a: 66; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genera
of Cerapachyini</span></b><span lang=EN-GB>: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Cerapachys, *Procerapachys, Simopone, Sphinctomyrmex</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe <span style='color:red'>Cerapachyini</span>
references <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Emery, 1911d: 6
(diagnosis, genera key); Arnold, 1915: 11 (South Africa genera key); Forel,
1917: 239 (synoptic classification); Wheeler, W.M. 1918a: 224, 239 (Australia
genera, key); Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 639 (genera key); Borgmeier, 1923: 50
(Brazil catalogue); Wilson, 1959b: 39 (Melanesia fauna); Brown, 1975: 14
(diagnosis, genera key); Bolton, 1990a: 61 (abdominal morphology); Bolton,
1994: 19 (synoptic classification); Bolton, 1995a: 1038 (census); Bolton,
1995b: 10 (catalogue); Shattuck, 1999: 25, 60 (Australia, genera key,
synopsis); Andersen, 2000: 33 (northern Australia, genera); Bolton, 2003: 33,
139 (diagnosis, synopsis).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genera
of <span style='color:red'>Cerapachyini</span><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus
<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>CERAPACHYS</span></i>
<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cerapachys</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Smith, F.
1857a: 74. Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cerapachys
antennatus</i>, by subsequent designation of Bingham, 1903: 28.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cerapachys</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae: Smith, F. 1857a: 74 [Myrmicidae]; Smith, F. 1861b:
47 [Myrmicidae]; Smith, F. 1871a: 329 [Myrmicidae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cerapachys</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Ponerinae: Dalla Torre, 1893: 17.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

lang=EN-GB> in Dorylinae, Cerapachyini: Emery, 1895j: 765; Emery, 1901a: 34.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cerapachys</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Ponerinae, Cerapachyini: Forel, 1893a: 162 (also misspelled <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Orapachys</i>, same page); Forel, 1900d:
331; Ashmead, 1905b: 382; Wheeler, W.M. 1910g: 137; Emery, 1911d: 8; Arnold, 1915:
11; Forel, 1917: 239; Brown, 1975: 18; Snelling, 1981: 389; Dlussky &amp;

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cerapachys</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Cerapachyinae, Cerapachyini: Wheeler, W.M. 1902d: 185; Wheeler,
W.M. 1922a: 639; Donisthorpe, 1943f: 632; Chapman &amp; Capco, 1951: 17; Kempf,
1972a: 76; Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1985: 256; Bolton, 1990a: 67;

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Lioponera</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Cerapachyinae, Cerapachyini: Wheeler, W.M. 1902d: 185; Wheeler,
W.M. 1922a: 639; Donisthorpe, 1943f: 657.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Lioponera</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cerapachys</i>:
Forel, 1892l: 244.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Lioponera</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as genus: Mayr, 1879: 666; Dalla Torre, 1893: 17; Forel, 1900d:
329; Bingham, 1903: 26; Emery, 1911d: 11; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 639;
Donisthorpe, 1943f: 657.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Lioponera</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cerapachys</i>:
Brown, 1975: 19; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:

André, 1882c: 235. Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Parasyscia
piochardi</i>, by monotypy. </span></p>

(India &amp; Sri Lanka species key); Bingham, 1903: 27, 28 (India, Sri Lanka
&amp; Burma <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Lioponera, Cerapachys</i>
species keys); Emery, 1911d: 8 (diagnosis, subgenera key, catalogue); Emery,
1911d: 9 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>C. (Parasyscia)</i> diagnosis,
catalogue); Emery, 1911d: 10 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>C.
(Ooceraea)</i> &amp; <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>C. (Syscia)</i>
diagnoses, catalogues); Emery, 1911d: 10 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Phyracaces</i>
diagnosis, catalogue); Emery, 1911d: 11 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Lioponera</i>
diagnosis, catalogue); Arnold, 1915: 11 (diagnosis, South Africa species key);
Wheeler, W.M. 1918a: 239 (Australia <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Phyracaces</i>
species key); Mann, 1921: 408 (Fiji species key); Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 52, 53,
639 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cerapachys</i> &amp; <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Phyracaces</i> diagnoses, subgenera key);
Wheeler, W.M. 1924d: 224 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Chrysapace</i>,

1939a: 253 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Lioponera</i> diagnosis);

(Melanesia, Fiji Is, New Guinea &amp; New Caledonia species keys); Kempf,
1972a: 76 (Neotropical catalogue); Brown, 1975: 18, 26 (diagnosis, keys);

1985: 23 (Australia catalogue); Taylor, 1987a: 16 (Australia, New Caledonia

1989: 30 (Japan species key); Bolton, 1995a: 1048 (census); Bolton, 1995b: 142
(catalogue); Wu, J. &amp; Wang, 1995: 47 (China species key); Collingwood &amp;

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-right:-1.25pt;text-align:justify;tab-stops:
6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus *<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>PROCERAPACHYS</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB>*<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Procerapachys</i></b> Wheeler, W.M. 1915h:
27. Type-species: *<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Procerapachys annosus</i>,
by original designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Procerapachys</i>
in Ponerinae, Cerapachyini: Wheeler, W.M 1915h: 27; Dlussky &amp; Fedoseeva,
1988: 79. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Procerapachys</i>
in Cerapachyinae, Cerapachyini: Donisthorpe, 1943f: 686.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB>*<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Procerapachys</i>
as genus: Dlussky &amp; Fedoseeva, 1988: 79; Dlussky, 2009: 1073.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Sphinctomyrmex</i>:
Bolton, 1973a: 341; Brown, 1975: 31; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='color:red'>Sphinctomyrmex</span></i> references <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-right:-1.25pt;text-align:justify;tab-stops:
6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB>Dalla Torre, 1893: 16 (catalogue); Bingham, 1903: 25
(India, Sri Lanka &amp; Burma species key); Emery, 1911d: 6 (diagnosis,
catalogue); Emery, 1911d: 7 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>S. (Eusphinctus)</i>
diagnosis, catalogue); Wheeler, W.M. 1918a: 224 (Australia <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Eusphinctus</i> species key); Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 639 (<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Eusphinctus</i> subgenera key); Wheeler,
W.M. 1922a: 755 (Afrotropical catalogue); Chapman &amp; Capco, 1951: 21 (Asia
checklist); Kempf, 1972a: 241 (Neotropical catalogue); Brown, 1975: 31
(diagnosis, key); Taylor &amp; Brown, D.R. 1985: 49 (Australia catalogue);
Taylor, 1987a: 73 (Australia, New Caledonia checklist); Bolton, 1995a: 1052
(census); Bolton, 1995b: 392 (catalogue); Shattuck, 1999: 62 (Australia
synopsis).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

text-indent:-.5in;tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Subfamily
<span style='color:red'>ECITONINAE</span> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Ecitonii</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Forel, 1893a: 163. Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Eciton</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Ecitoninae as subfamily of Dorylidae: Ashmead, 1905b: 381; Ashmead,
1906: 23.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Ecitoninae as subfamily of Formicidae: Brown, 1973b: 166; Snelling,
1981: 392; Bolton, 1990c: 1357; Hölldobler &amp; Wilson, 1990: 11; all
subsequent authors. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Ecitoninae as dorylomorph subfamily of Formicidae: Bolton, 2003: 34,
142; Brady &amp; Ward, 2005: 593. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Ecitoninae as formicoid subfamily of Formicidae: Moreau, Bell, <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 102.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Ecitoninae as formicoid dorylomorph subfamily of Formicidae: Brady,
Schultz, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 18173; Ward,
2007a: 555. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;

of Ecitoninae</span></b><span lang=EN-GB>: Cheliomyrmecini, Ecitonini.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

lang=EN-GB>Ecitonini as tribe of Dorylinae: Forel, 1893a: 163 [Ecitonii];

[Ecitii]; Emery, 1904a: 116 [Ecitii]; Wheeler, W.M. 1910g: 138 [Ecitonii];
Emery, 1910b: 15 [Ecitini]; Arnold, 1915: 113 [Ecitini]; Forel, 1917: 240

Donisthorpe, 1943f: 618 [Ecitini]; Borgmeier, 1955: 77; Watkins, 1976: 6;
Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1985: 256; Dlussky &amp; Fedoseeva, 1988: 79.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Ecitonini as tribe of Ecitoninae: Ashmead, 1905b: 381; Ashmead,
1906: 24; Bolton, 1990c: 1357; Jaffe 1993: 12; Bolton, 1994: 39; all subsequent
authors. </span></p>

tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus
<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>ECITON</span></i>
<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;

1804: 179. Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica hamata</i>,
by subsequent designation of Shuckard, in Swainson &amp; Shuckard, 1840: 173. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Eciton</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicites: Lepeletier de Saint-Fargeau, 1835: 172.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Eciton</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Poneridae, Myrmicidae: Smith, F. 1858b: 148.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Eciton</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae: Mayr, 1865: 17 [Myrmicidae]; Cresson, 1887: 259<span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>[Myrmicidae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Eciton</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Dorylinae: Forel, 1878: 365 (footnote) [Dorylidae]; Dalla Torre,
1893: 1; Forel, 1895b: 118; Forel, 1899c: 22.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Eciton</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Dorylinae, Ecitonini: Forel, 1893a: 163; Emery, 1895j: 765
[Ecitonii]; Emery, 1910b: 17 [Ecitini]; Wheeler, W.M. 1910g: 138; Forel, 1917:
240; Gallardo, 1920: 312; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 635; Borgmeier, 1923: 37;
Donisthorpe, 1943f: 641; Borgmeier, 1955: 79; Kempf, 1972a: 101; Dlussky &amp;
Fedoseeva, 1988: 79. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Eciton</span></i><span

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Eciton</span></i><span

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB style='color:purple'>Ancylognathus</span></i></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Lund, 1831a: 121, 135. Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Ancylognathus lugubris, nomen nudum</i>. [<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Camptognatha</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Gray, G.R. 1832: 516.
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Camptognatha testacea</i>
(junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica hamata</i>),
by monotypy. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

Smith, F. 1855c: 160; Roger, 1863b: 36; Dalla Torre, 1893: 1; Emery, 1910b: 19;
Borgmeier, 1955: 162; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

fargeavii</i> (junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Atta
quadriglumis</i>), by original designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

(junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica coeca</i>), by

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Pseudodichthadia</span></i><span

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Pseudodichthadia</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Labidus</i>:
Emery, 1910b: 21; Borgmeier, 1955: 80; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

<span style='color:red'>LEPTANILLOIDINAE</span> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Leptanilloidinae</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Bolton, in Baroni Urbani, Bolton &amp; Ward, 1992: 317. Type-genus:
<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Leptanilloides</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB>Leptanilloidinae as subfamily of Formicidae:
Bolton, in Baroni Urbani, Bolton &amp; Ward, 1992: 317; Bolton, 1994: 71;
Brandão, Diniz, Agosti &amp; Delabie, 1999: 17; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Leptanilloidinae as dorylomorph subfamily of Formicidae: Bolton, 2003:
35, 145; Brady &amp; Ward, 2005: 593.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Leptanilloidinae as formicoid subfamily of Formicidae: Moreau, Bell,
<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 102.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Leptanilloidinae as formicoid dorylomorph subfamily of Formicidae:
Brady, Schultz, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 18173;
Ward, 2007a: 555. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe
of Leptanilloidinae</span></b><span lang=EN-GB>: Leptanilloidini.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe
<span style='color:red'>LEPTANILLOIDINI</span><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Leptanilloidini</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Bolton, in Baroni Urbani, Bolton &amp; Ward, 1992: 317. Type-genus:
<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Leptanilloides</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB>As for subfamily.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genera
of Leptanilloidini</span></b><span lang=EN-GB>: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Amyrmex, Asphinctanilloides, Leptanilloides</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Subfamily and tribe <span style='color:red'>Leptanilloidini</span>
references <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Baroni Urbani,
Bolton &amp; Ward, 1992: 317 (phylogeny); Bolton, 1994: 71 (diagnosis, synoptic
classification); Bolton, 1995a: 1040 (census); Bolton, 1995b: 12 (catalogue);
Brandão, Diniz, Agosti &amp; Delabie, 1999: 17 (diagnosis, genera revision,
phylogeny, keys); Bolton, 2003: 35, 145 (diagnosis, synopsis); Brady &amp;
Ward, 2005: 593 (phylogeny); Moreau, Bell, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>et
al</i>. 2006: 102 (phylogeny); Brady, Schultz, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 18173 (phylogeny); Ward, 2007a: 555 (classification).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-right:-1.25pt;text-align:justify;tab-stops:
6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genera
of <span style='color:red'>Leptanilloidini<o:p></o:p></span></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='color:red'>AMYRMEX</span></i> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Amyrmex</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Kusnezov, 1953b: 333.
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Amyrmex golbachi</i>, by
original designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Amyrmex</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Dolichoderinae, Tapinomini: Kusnezov, 1953b: 333; Kempf, 1972a:
20; Dlussky &amp; Fedoseeva, 1988: 77; Dubovikov, 2005: 91 (implied).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Amyrmex incertae sedis</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Formicidae: Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1985: 259.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Amyrmex</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Leptanilloidinae: Ward &amp; Brady, 2009: 48.</span></p>

style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Amyrmex</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Forelius</i>:
Shattuck, 1992c: 87; Shattuck, 1994: 91; Bolton, 1994: 26; Bolton, 1995b: 20.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Subfamily
<span style='color:red'>AENICTINAE</span> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Aenictii</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Emery, 1901a: 36. Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Aenictus</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Aenictinae as subfamily of Formicidae: Bolton, 1990c: 1358; Baroni
Urbani, Bolton &amp; Ward, 1992: 315; Bolton, 1994: 12; Wu, J. &amp; Wang,
1995: 49; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Aenictinae as dorylomorph subfamily of Formicidae: Bolton, 2003: 36,
146; Brady &amp; Ward, 2005: 593.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Aenictinae as formicoid subfamily of Formicidae: Moreau, Bell, <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 102.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Aenictinae as formicoid dorylomorph subfamily of Formicidae: Brady,
Schultz, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 18173; Ward,
2007a: 555. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe
of Aenictinae</span></b><span lang=EN-GB>: Aenictini.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe
<span style='color:red'>AENICTINI</span><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Aenictii</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Emery, 1901a: 36. Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Aenictus</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Aenictini as tribe of Dorylinae: Emery, 1901a: 36 [Aenictii]; Emery,
1904a: 116 [Aenictii]; Borgmeier, 1954c: 212; Borgmeier, 1955: 57; Dlussky
&amp; Fedoseeva, 1988: 79; Hölldobler &amp; Wilson, 1990: 11.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB>Aenictini as tribe of Ecitoninae: Ashmead,
1905b: 381; Ashmead, 1906: 24.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Aenictini as
junior synonym of Ecitonini: Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1985: 256 [Aenictii].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB>Aenictini as tribe of Aenictinae: Bolton,
1994: 12; Bolton, 2003: 146.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus
of Aenictini</span></b><span lang=EN-GB>: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Aenictus</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus
(extinct) <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>incertae sedis</i> in
Aenictinae</span></b><span lang=EN-GB>: *<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Eoaenictites</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Subfamily, tribe <span style='color:red'>Aenictini</span>
and genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>Aenictus</span></i>
references <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Roger, 1863b:
36, 41 (catalogue); Mayr, 1863: 394, 457 (catalogue); Mayr, 1865: 17 (<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Aenictus, Typhlatta</i> diagnoses); Mayr,
1879: 668 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Typhlatta</i> species key);
Dalla Torre, 1893: 7 (catalogue); Forel, 1901a: 464 (India &amp; Sri Lanka
species key); Bingham, 1903: 6 (diagnosis, India, Sri Lanka &amp; Burma species
key); Ashmead, 1906: 24 (genera key); Emery, 1910b: 28 (diagnosis, catalogue);
Arnold, 1915: 136, 137 (diagnosis, South Africa species key); Wheeler, W.M.
1922a: 751 (Afrotropical catalogue); Wheeler, W.M. 1930g: 198, 207 (<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>A. (Typhlatta)</i> &amp; Philippines <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>A. (Aenictus)</i> species keys); Chapman
&amp; Capco, 1951: 10 (Asia checklist); Wilson, 1964a: 436 (Indo-Australian
species, revision, key); Taylor &amp; Brown, D.R. 1985: 52 (Australia
catalogue); Taylor, 1987a: 6 (Australia, New Caledonia &amp; New Zealand
checklists); Billen &amp; Gotwald, 1988: 293 (Dufour's gland); Terayama &amp;
Yamane, 1989: 602 (Indonesia, Sumatra species key); Dlussky, Soyunov &amp;
Zabelin, 1990: 179 (Turkmenistan species key); Bolton, 1990c: 1358 (diagnosis,
morphology, phylogeny); Baroni Urbani, Bolton &amp; Ward, 1992: 315
(phylogeny); Bolton, 1994: 12 (diagnosis, synoptic classification); Xu, 1994a:
118 (China species key); Bolton, 1995a: 1047 (census); Bolton, 1995b: 58
(catalogue); Wu, J. &amp; Wang, 1995: 50 (China species key); Hölldobler, Obermayer
&amp; Peeters, 1996: 158 (metatibial gland); Shattuck, 1999: 58 (Australia
synopsis); Billen, Gobin &amp; Ito, 1999: 307 (postpygidial gland); Zhou,
2001b: 58 (China, Guangxi species key); Perfil’eva, 2002: 1239 (venation);
Brady, 2003: 6575 (phylogeny); Bolton, 2003: 36, 146 (diagnosis, synopsis);
Brady &amp; Ward, 2005: 593 (phylogeny); Moreau, Bell, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 102 (phylogeny); Brady, Schultz, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 18173 (phylogeny); Ward, 2007a: 555 (classification);
Shattuck, 2008c: 3 (Australia species key); Terayama, 2009: 124 (Taiwan species
key).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

of <span style='color:red'>Aenictini</span><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus
<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>AENICTUS</span></i>
<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;
tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Aenictus</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Shuckard,
1840b: 266. Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Aenictus
ambiguus</i>, by original designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

tab-stops:6.25in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Aenictus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Dorylidae: Shuckard, 1840b: 266; Smith, F. 1859b: 9; Smith, F.
1871a: 336.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

(footnote) [Dorylidae]; Dalla Torre, 1893: 7.</span></p>

1910g: 137.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

laeviceps</i>, by monotypy. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:-1.25pt;margin-bottom:

silvestrii</i>, by monotypy. </span></p>

tab-stops:6.25in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus
<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>incertae sedis</i> in <span
