</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:center;
text-indent:-.5in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>THE
MYRMICOMORPHS: SUBFAMILY MYRMICINAE<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:center;
text-indent:-.5in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>SUBFAMILY
<span style='color:red'>MYRMICINAE</span><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Subfamily <span
style='color:red'>MYRMICINAE</span> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Myrmicites</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Lepeletier de Saint-Fargeau, 1835: 169. Type-genus: <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Myrmica</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Myrmicinae as group name: Lepeletier de Saint-Fargeau, 1835: 169
[Myrmicites]; Nylander, 1846a: 877 [Myrmicae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Myrmicinae as family: Smith, F. 1851: 4 [Myrmicidae]; Smith, F.
1861b: 45 [Myrmicidae]; Smith, F. 1871a: 324 [Myrmicidae]; André, 1882a: 125
[Myrmicidae]; Cresson, 1887: 93 [Myrmicidae]; Emery, 1894g: 383 [Myrmicidae];
Saunders, 1896: 18 [Myrmicidae]; Ashmead, 1905b: 383 [Myrmicidae]; Novák &amp;
Sadil, 1941: 71 [Myrmicidae]; Bernard, 1951: 1058 [Myrmicidae]; Bernard, 1953b:
222 [Myrmicidae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Myrmicinae as subfamily of Poneridae: Smith, F. 1858b: 114
[Myrmicidae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Myrmicinae as tribe of Formicidae: André, 1874: 167 [Myrmicidae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Myrmicinae as subfamily of Myrmicidae: Ashmead, 1905b: 383.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Myrmicinae as subfamily of Formicidae: Mayr, 1855: 290, 299
[Myrmicidae]; Smith, F. 1857a: 70 [Myrmicidae]; Mayr, 1861: 21 [Myrmicidae];
Smith, F. 1862b: 33 [Myrmicidae]; Mayr, 1862: 738 [Myrmicidae]; Mayr, 1865: 17
[Myrmicidae]; Mayr, 1868c: 24 [Myrmicidae]; Forel, 1870: 307 [Myrmicidae];
Forel, 1874: 22 [Myrmicidae]; Emery, 1877a: 70 [Myrmicidae]; Forel, 1878: 367
[Myrmicidae]; Emery &amp; Forel, 1879a: 456 [Myrmicidae]; André, 1881b: 64
[Myrmicidae]; Nasonov, 1889: 28 [Myrmicidae]; Forel, 1891b: 11 [Myrmicidae];
Forel, 1892j: 220 [Myrmicidae]; Forel, 1893a: 163; Dalla Torre, 1893: 53;
Emery, 1895j: 768 [subfamily spelled Myrmicini]; Emery, 1896e: 179; Forel,
1899c: 30; Forel, 1902f: 520; Bingham, 1903: 105; Wheeler, W.M. 1910g: 138;
Emery, 1914a: 29; Wheeler, 1915g: 806 [Myrmicides]; Wheeler, W.M. 1915h: 40;
Donisthorpe, 1915d: 74; Arnold, 1916: 166; Escherich, 1917: 2 [Myrmicini];
Forel, 1917: 240 [subfamily spelled Myrmicini]; Bondroit, 1918: 14
[Myrmicitae]; Wheeler, W.M. 1920: 53; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 124; Emery, 1921f:
3; Karavaiev, 1934: 59; Clark, 1951: 16; Brown, 1954e: 28; Wheeler, G.C. &amp;
Wheeler, J. 1972a: 40; Brown, 1973b: 166; all subsequent authors. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Myrmicinae as myrmicomorph subfamily of Formicidae: Bolton, 2003:
52, 182.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Myrmicinae as formicoid subfamily of Formicidae: Moreau, Bell, <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 102; Brady, Schultz, <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 18173.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Myrmicinae as formicoid myrmicomorph subfamily of Formicidae: Ward,
2007a: 556.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribes of Myrmicinae</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB>: Adelomyrmecini, Ankylomyrmini, Attini, Basicerotini,
Blepharidattini, Cataulacini, Cephalotini, Crematogastrini, Dacetini,
Formicoxenini, Lenomyrmecini, Liomyrmecini, Melissotarsini, Meranoplini,
Metaponini, Myrmecinini, Myrmicariini, Myrmicini, Paratopulini,
Phalacromyrmecini, Pheidolini, Solenopsidini, Stegomyrmecini, Stenammini,
Tetramoriini.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus (extant) <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>incertae sedis</i> in Myrmicinae</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB>: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Diaphoromyrma, Tyrannomyrmex</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genera (extinct) <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>incertae sedis</i> in Myrmicinae</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB>: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>*Afromyrma, *Attopsis,
*Cephalomyrmex, *Electromyrmex, *Eocenidris, *Eomyrmex, *Fallomyrma,
*Miosolenopsis, *Myrmecites, *Solenopsites.<o:p></o:p></i></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Hong (2002) genera
(extinct) <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>incertae sedis</i> in
Myrmicinae</span></b><span lang=EN-GB>: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>*Brachytarsites,
*Clavipetiola, *Fushunomyrmex, *Orbigastrula, *Quadrulicapito, *Quinqueangulicapito,
*Sinomyrmex, *Sphaerogasterites, *Wumyrmex.<o:p></o:p></i></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Collective group name in
Myrmicinae</span></b><span lang=EN-GB>: *<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='color:green'>Myrmicites</span></i>. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Subfamily <span
style='color:red'>Myrmicinae</span> references, world <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Mayr, 1865: 17
(diagnosis); Mayr, 1867a: 91 (diagnosis); Forel, 1878: 367 (diagnosis);
Handlirsch, 1907: 872 (*fossil taxa catalogue); Dalla Torre, 1893: 53
(catalogue); Emery, 1895j: 768 (diagnosis); Emery, 1896e: 179 (genera key);
Wheeler, W.M. 1910g: 138 (diagnosis); Emery, 1912b: 101 (phylogeny); Emery,
1914a: 34 (phylogeny, tribe key); Arnold, 1916: 164 (diagnosis); Forel, 1917:
240 (synoptic classification); Forel, 1921c: 139 (diagnosis); Emery, 1921f: 3
(diagnosis, tribes &amp; genera key, catalogue); Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 124, 655
(diagnosis, tribes key); Brown &amp; Nutting, 1950: 126 (venation, phylogeny);
Brown, 1954e: 28 (phylogeny); Eisner, 1957: 477 (proventriculus morphology);
Bernard, 1967: 93 (diagnosis); Gotwald, 1969: 99 (mouthparts morphology); Wheeler,
G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1972a: 40 (diagnosis); Brown, 1973b: 166 (genera,
distribution); Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1976b: 52 (larvae, review &amp;
synthesis); Kugler, C. 1978a: 413 (sting structure); Kugler, C. 1978b: 267
(pygidial glands); Kugler, C. 1979c: 117 (sting, evolution); Snelling, 1981:
393 (synoptic classification); Caetano, F.H. 1984: 257 (digestive tract,
morphology); Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1985: 257 (synoptic
classification); Billen, 1986: 167 (Dufour's gland); Dlussky &amp; Fedoseeva,
1988: 79 (synoptic classification); Hölldobler &amp; Wilson, 1990: 9 onward
(synoptic classification, genera keys); Baroni Urbani, Bolton &amp; Ward, 1992:
317 (phylogeny); Bolton, 1994: 75 (diagnosis, synoptic classification, genera
keys); Bolton, 1995a: 1040 (census); Bolton, 1995b: 13 (catalogue); Hashimoto,
1996: 354 (phylogenetic position); Baroni Urbani, 2000: 480 (phylogeny);
Dlussky &amp; Rasnitsyn, 2002: 422 (diagnosis for wingless fossils); Bolton,
2003: 52, 182 (diagnosis, synopsis); Moreau, Bell, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 102 (phylogeny); Brady, Schultz, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>et al</i>. 2006: 18173 (phylogeny); Ward, 2007a: 556 (classification).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Regional and national
faunas with keys <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Mayr, 1855: 391
(Austria); Mayr, 1861: 29 (Europe); Mayr, 1868c: 79 (*Baltic Amber); André,
1874: 171 (Europe); Forel, 1874: 29 (Switzerland); Saunders, E. 1880: 213
(Britain); André, 1882c: 256 (Europe &amp; Algeria); Cresson, 1887: 98 (U.S.A.
genera); Provancher, 1887: 243 (Canada); Nasonov, 1889: 54 (Russia); Forel,

(India &amp; Sri Lanka genera); Bingham, 1903: 105 (India, Sri Lanka &amp;

Bondroit, 1910: 490 (Belgium); Wheeler, W.M. 1910g: 558 (North America genera);
Stitz, 1914: 55 (Central Europe); Gallardo, 1915: 32 (Argentina genera); Forel,

1926: 84 (Netherlands); Karavaiev, 1927c: 256 (Ukraine); Donisthorpe, 1927b: 77

Holgersen, 1944: 198 (Norway); Buren, 1944a: 281 (U.S.A., Iowa); Smith, M.R.
1947f: 543 (U.S.A. genera); Boven, 1947: 170 (Belgium); Creighton, 1950a: 83

Kutter, 1977c: 31 (Switzerland); Arnol'di &amp; Dlussky, 1978: 524 (former
European U.S.S.R.); Collingwood, 1978: 75 (Iberian Peninsula); Collingwood,
1979: 36 (Fennoscandia &amp; Denmark); Greenslade, 1979: 20 (South Australia
genera); Schembri &amp; Collingwood, 1981: 423 (Malta); Allred, 1982: 438
(U.S.A., Utah); Baroni Urbani, 1984: 76 (Neotropical genera); Verhaeghe,
Deligne, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>et al</i>. 1984: 112 (Belgium

Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1986g: 20 (U.S.A., Nevada); Nilsson &amp;

Dlussky, Soyunov &amp; Zabelin, 1990: 181 (Turkmenistan); Kupyanskaya, 1990: 89
(Far Eastern Russia); Ogata, 1991b: 61 (Japan genera); Morisita, Kubota, <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>et al</i>. 1992: 1 (Japan); Atanasov &amp;
Dlussky, 1992: 51 (Bulgaria); Lattke, in Jaffe, 1993: 153 (Neotropical genera);
Arakelian, 1994: 15 (Armenia); Wu, J. &amp; Wang, 1995: 57 (China genera);
Kupyanskaya, 1995: 327 (Far Eastern Russia); Collingwood &amp; Agosti, 1996:

&amp; Czechowska, 2002: 135 (Poland); Aktaç &amp; Radchenko, 2002: 55 (Turkey

Radchenko, 2005b: 184 (North Korea); Clouse, 2007b: 190 (Micronesia); Seifert,
2007: 110 (North and Central Europe); Terayama, 2009: 131 (Taiwan).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe <span
style='color:red'>BASICEROTINI</span> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Basicerotini</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Brown, 1949f: 86. Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Basiceros</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Basicerotini as junior synonym of Dacetini: Baroni Urbani &amp; De
Andrade, 1994: 10; Baroni Urbani &amp; De Andrade, 2007: 81.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Basicerotini as tribe of Myrmicinae: Brown, 1949f: 86; Brown &amp;
Kempf, 1960: 162; Taylor, 1968b: 333; Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1976b:
60; Kugler, C. 1978a: 438; Dlussky &amp; Fedoseeva, 1988: 80; Hölldobler &amp;
Wilson, 1990: 16; Taylor, 1990b: 397; Brandão, 1991: 391; Bolton, 1994: 104;
Bolton, 1995b: 9; Bolton, 1998: 70; Fernández, 2003d: 313; Bolton, 2003: 53,
183. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genera of Basicerotini</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB>: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Basiceros, Eurhopalothrix,
Octostruma, Protalaridris, Rhopalothrix, Talaridris</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe <span
style='color:red'>Basicerotini</span> references <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Brown, 1949f: 86
(diagnosis, genera); Brown &amp; Kempf, 1960: 161, 243 (diagnosis, genera
revision, key); Taylor, 1968b: 334 (Indo-Australian species key); Wheeler, G.C.
&amp; Wheeler, J. 1976b: 60 (larvae, review &amp; synthesis); Kugler, C. 1978a:
438 (sting structure); Dlussky &amp; Fedoseeva, 1988: 80 (synoptic
classification); Taylor, 1990b: 401 (Old World species key); Hölldobler &amp;
Wilson, 1990: 16 (synoptic classification); Brandão, 1991: 391 (Neotropical
fauna, synoptic classification); Baroni Urbani &amp; De Andrade, 1994: 9
(review of tribe, classification &amp; phylogeny); Bolton, 1994: 105 (synoptic
classification); Bolton, 1995a: 1040 (census); Bolton, 1995b: 9 (catalogue);
Bolton, 1998: 70 (comparative morphology, monophyly, relationships); Bolton,
2003: 53, 183 (diagnosis, synopsis); Baroni Urbani &amp; De Andrade, 2007: 81
(classification).</span></p>

lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genera of <span

lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

lang=EN-GB>Basiceros</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Schulz, W.A. 1906: 156. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Basicerotini: Brown &amp; Kempf, 1960: 179.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Aspididris</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as genus: Weber, 1950c: 3; Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1985:
257 (anachronism); Dlussky &amp; Fedoseeva, 1988: 80 (anachronism).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Aspididris</span></i><span

Brown, 1974c: 132.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Roger, 1863b: 40
(catalogue); Mayr, 1863: 403 (catalogue); Mayr, 1865: 26 (diagnosis); Emery,
1924d: 327 (diagnosis, catalogue); Brown &amp; Kempf, 1960: 171, 178, 243
(diagnosis, all species revision, key); Brown &amp; Kempf, 1960: 179, 244

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Eurhopalothrix</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Brown &amp; Kempf,
1961: 44. Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Rhopalothrix
bolaui</i>, by original designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>[<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Eurhopalothrix</i> Brown
&amp; Kempf, 1960: 202; unavailable name, proposed without designation of
type-species.]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Eurhopalothrix</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Basicerotini: Brown &amp; Kempf, 1961: 44; all
subsequent authors except the entries below; Bolton, 1998: 67; Bolton, 2003:
184.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Eurhopalothrix</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Dacetini: Baroni Urbani &amp; De Andrade, 1994: 31;
Baroni Urbani &amp; De Andrade, 2007: 88 (as junior synonym of <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Basiceros</i>).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'><span style='color:red'>Eurhopalothrix</span></i> references <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Brown &amp;
Kempf, 1960: 202, 245 (diagnosis, all species revision, key); Snelling, 1968c:
3 (supplement to Brown &amp; Kempf, 1960 key); Taylor, 1968b: 334
(Indo-Australian species key); Taylor, 1970a: 51 (supplement to Taylor, 1968b
key); Kempf, 1972a: 107 (Neotropical catalogue); Smith, D.R. 1979: 1409 (North
America catalogue); Taylor &amp; Brown, D.R. 1985: 64 (Australia catalogue);
Taylor, 1987a: 26 (Australia, New Caledonia checklist); Taylor, 1990b: 401 (Old
World species key); Brandão, 1991: 343 (Neotropical catalogue); Bolton, 1995a:
1049 (census); Bolton, 1995b: 189 (catalogue); Shattuck, 1999: 135 (Australia
synopsis); Ketterl, Verhaag &amp; Dietz, 2004: 48 (Neotropical species key);
Mezger &amp; Pfeiffer, 2010: 135 (<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>platisquama</i>
group key).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'><span style='color:red'>OCTOSTRUMA</span></i> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Octostruma</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Forel, 1912e: 196 [as
subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Rhopalothrix</i>].
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Rhopalothrix simoni</i>
(junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Rhopalothrix iheringi</i>),
by subsequent designation of Wheeler, W.M. 1913a: 82. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Octostruma</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Dacetini: Forel, 1917: 246; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a:
667; Emery, 1924d: 328; Donisthorpe, 1943f: 676; Brown, 1948e: 102; Baroni
Urbani &amp; De Andrade, 1994: 31.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Octostruma</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Basicerotini: Brown, 1949f: 92; all subsequent
authors to the last entry above; Bolton, 1994: 105; Bolton, 1998: 67.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Octostruma</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Rhopalothrix</i>:
Forel, 1917: 246; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 667; Emery, 1924d: 328.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Octostruma</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as genus: Brown, 1948e: 102; Brown, 1949f: 92; Brown &amp; Kempf,
1960: 181; all subsequent authors except the following.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Octostruma</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Basiceros</i>:
Baroni Urbani &amp; De Andrade, 2007: 88.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span

Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Protalaridris armata</i>,
by original designation.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

by subsequent designation of Wheeler, W.M. 1911f: 172. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe <span
style='color:red'>DACETINI</span> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Dacetonini</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Forel, 1892d: 344. Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Daceton</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Dacetini as subfamily of Cryptoceridae: Ashmead, 1905b: 383
[Dacetonini].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Dacetini as tribe of Myrmicinae: Forel, 1892d: 344 [Dacetonini genus
group]; Forel, 1893a: 164 [Dacetonii]; Forel, 1895b: 133 [Dacetonii]; Emery,
1895j: 770<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>[Dacetii]; Forel,
1899c: 41 [Dacetii]; Wheeler, W.M. 1910g: 141 [Dacetonii]; Emery, 1914a: 39; Wheeler,
W.M. 1915e: 491 [Dacetoniini (in text)]; Arnold, 1917: 372; Forel, 1917: 246;
Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 655, 666 [Dacetonini]; Emery, 1924d: 312; Brown, 1948e:
125; subsequent authors to Bolton, 1994: 105 [Dacetonini]; Bolton, 1995b: 10;
Bolton, 1999: 1639 [Dacetonini]; Bolton, 2000: 12; Bolton, 2003: 54, 185;
Baroni Urbani &amp; De Andrade, 2007: 81.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Junior synonyms of <span
style='color:red'>DACETINI<o:p></o:p></span></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Dacetiti</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Brown, 1952g: 10 (footnote). Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Daceton</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Dacetiti as subtribe of Dacetini: Brown, 1952g: 10; Brown, 1954b:
465 (definition); Brown &amp; Wilson, 1959b: 281.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Dacetiti as junior synonym of Dacetini: Baroni Urbani &amp; De
Andrade, 1994: 9.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Epopostrumiti</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Brown, 1952g: 10 (footnote). Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Epopostruma</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Epopostrumiti as subtribe of Dacetini: Brown, 1952g: 10; Brown,
1954b: 465 (definition); Brown &amp; Wilson, 1959b: 281.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Epopostrumiti as junior synonym of Dacetini: Baroni Urbani &amp; De
Andrade, 1994: 9.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Orectognathiti</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Brown, 1952g: 10 (footnote). Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Orectognathus</i>. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Orectognathiti as subtribe of Dacetini: Brown, 1952g: 10; Brown,
1953k: 85 (definition); Brown, 1954b: 465; Brown &amp; Wilson, 1959b: 281.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Orectognathiti as junior synonym of Dacetini: Baroni Urbani &amp; De
Andrade, 1994: 9.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>[<span style='color:purple'>Arestognathiti</span> Brown, 1952g: 10,
incorrect subsequent spelling.]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Strumigeniti</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Brown, 1952g: 10 (footnote). Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Strumigenys</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

lang=EN-GB>Strumigeniti as subtribe of Dacetini: Brown, 1952g: 10; Brown,
1954b: 465; Brown &amp; Wilson, 1959b: 281.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Strumigeniti as junior synonym of Dacetini: Baroni Urbani &amp; De
Andrade, 1994: 9.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genera of Dacetini</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB>: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Acanthognathus,
Colobostruma, Daceton, Epopostruma, Mesostruma, Microdaceton, Orectognathus,
Pyramica, Strumigenys</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Roger, 1863b: 40

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'><span style='color:red'>EPOPOSTRUMA</span></i> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Epopostruma</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Forel, 1895f: 422 [as
subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Strumigenys</i>].
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Strumigenys (Epopostruma)
quadrispinosa</i>, by subsequent designation of Wheeler, W.M. 1911f: 163. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Epopostruma</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Cryptoceridae, Dacetonini: Ashmead, 1905b: 384.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Epopostruma</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Dacetini: Emery, 1914a: 42; Forel, 1917: 246;
Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 667; Emery, 1924d: 329; Donisthorpe, 1943f: 644; Brown,
1948e: 119; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i

lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Strumigenys</i>:
Forel, 1895f: 422.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i

lang=EN-GB> as genus: Emery, 1897c: 573; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

original designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Trichoscapa</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Emery, 1869b: 24 [as
subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Strumigenys</i>].
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Strumigenys (Trichoscapa)
membranifera</i>, by monotypy. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Trichoscapa</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae: Emery &amp; Forel, 1879a: 464 [Myrmicidae]; Dalla
Torre, 1893: 145.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Trichoscapa</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Dacetini: Forel, 1917: 246; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a:
668; Emery, 1924d: 323; Donisthorpe, 1943g: 734; Brown, 1948e: 112; all
subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Trichoscapa</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Strumigenys</i>:
Emery &amp; Forel, 1879a: 464; Forel, 1917: 246; Creighton, 1950a: 304.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Trichoscapa</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Strumigenys</i>:
Dalla Torre, 1893: 145; Baroni Urbani &amp; De Andrade, 1994: 13; Baroni Urbani
&amp; De Andrade, 2007: 101. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Trichoscapa</span></i><span

Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 668; Emery, 1924d: 323; Donisthorpe, 1943g: 734.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Trichoscapa</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as genus: Brown, 1948e: 112; Kempf, 1972a: 255; Bolton, 1983: 319.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Trichoscapa</span></i><span

Bolton, 1999: 1667; Bolton, 2000: 90.</span></p>

monotypy. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>[Replacement name for <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cephaloxys</i>

Signoret, 1847: 294 (Hemiptera). Type-species not <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:

1948e: 104, repeated in Kempf, 1972a: 230, Bolton, 1983: 274 and Bolton, 1995b:
46.]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i

lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Dacetini: Brown, 1948e: 104.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Smithistruma</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Strumigenys</i>:
Baroni Urbani &amp; De Andrade, 1994: 14; Baroni Urbani &amp; De Andrade, 2007:
102. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>[<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cephaloxys</i> Smith, F.

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i

lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Dacetini: Brown, 1948e: 106.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Weberistruma</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as genus: Brown, 1949d: 7; Brown, 1953g: 24. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Weberistruma</span></i><span

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Weberistruma</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Pyramica</i>:
Bolton, 1999: 1668; Bolton, 2000: 91.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Weberistruma</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Strumigenys</i>:
Baroni Urbani &amp; De Andrade, 2007: 102. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Wessonistruma</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Brown, 1948e: 106 [as
subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Smithistruma</i>].
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Strumigenys pergandei</i>,
by original designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Wessonistruma</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Dacetini: Brown, 1948e: 106.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span

Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Dysedrognathus extemenus</i>,
by original designation. </span></p>

style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'><span style='color:red'>Strumigenys</span></i> references <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Roger, 1863b: 40
(catalogue); Mayr, 1863: 424, 455 (catalogue); Mayr, 1865: 26 (diagnosis);
Forel, 1886a: 216 (all species key); Mayr, 1887: 568 (all species key); Dalla
Torre, 1893: 145 (catalogue); Emery, 1895c: 325 (North America species key);
Emery, 1897c: 574 (New Guinea species key); Forel, 1903a: 707 (India &amp; Sri
Lanka species key); Bingham, 1903: 147 (India, Sri Lanka &amp; Burma species
key); Wheeler, W.M. 1908a: 146 (New World species key); Santschi, 1913b: 257
(Afrotropical species key); Arnold, 1917: 373 (diagnosis, South Africa species
key); Mann, 1921: 467 (Fiji Is species key); Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 917, 1034
(Afrotropical, Malagasy catalogues); Emery, 1924d: 319 (diagnosis, catalogue);
Brown, 1948e: 108 (diagnosis, review of genus); Brown, 1949d: 21 (Japan, China
&amp; Taiwan species key); Creighton, 1950a: 301 (North America species key);
Chapman &amp; Capco, 1951: 104, 107 (Asia <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Eneria,
Strumigenys (Strumigenys)</i> checklists); Brown, 1954k: 10 (Afrotropical
species revision, key); Brown, 1958h: 38 (New Zealand species); Brown, 1962c:
238 (Neotropical species synopsis, key); Kempf, 1972a: 226, 243 (Neotropical <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Quadristruma, Strumigenys</i> catalogues);
Alayo, 1974: 19 (Cuba species key); Kempf, 1976b: 43 (additions to Brown, 1962c
key); Smith, D.R. 1979: 1403, 1409 (North America <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Strumigenys, Quadristruma</i> catalogues); Bolton, 1983: 358, 400
(Afrotropical <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Strumigenys, Quadristruma</i>
species revisions, keys); Taylor &amp; Brown, D.R. 1985: 85, 87 (Australia <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Quadristruma, Strumigenys</i> catalogues);
Taylor, 1987a: 66, 76 (Australia, New Caledonia &amp; New Zealand checklists);
Terayama &amp; Kubota, 1989: 780 (Taiwan species key); Brandão, 1991: 380
(Neotropical catalogue); Arakelian &amp; Dlussky, 1991: 150 (former U.S.S.R.
species key); Morisita, Kubota, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>et al</i>.
1992: 63 (Japan species key); Dlussky, 1993: 53 (Fiji Is, Tonga and Samoa
species key); Bolton, 1994: 105 (synoptic classification); Bolton, 1995a: 1053
(census); Bolton, 1995b: 377, 395 (catalogue); Gronenberg, 1996: 2021 (mandible
morphology); Lin &amp; Wu, 1996: 139 (Taiwan species key); Lattke &amp; Goitía,
1997: 370 (Venezuela species key); Shattuck, 1999: 160, 167 (Australia
synopsis); Bolton, 1999: 1657, 1673 (morphology, diagnosis, review of genus,
phylogeny); Bolton, 2000: 496, 583, 716, 942 (Neotropical-Nearctic,
Afrotropical, Malesian-Oriental-East Palaearctic, Austral species revisions,
keys); Fisher, 2000: 614 (Malagasy species revision, key); Zhou, 2001b: 78
(China, Guangxi species key); Lin &amp; Wu, 2001: 166 (Taiwan species key);
Zhou &amp; Xu, 2003: 737 (China species key); Yoshimura &amp; Onoyama, 2007:
676 (Japan species key); Terayama, 2009: 142 (Taiwan species key).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe <span
style='color:red'>PHALACROMYRMECINI</span> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Phalacromyrmecini</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Dlussky &amp; Fedoseeva, 1988: 80. Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Phalacromyrmex</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>[Phalacromyrmecini Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1976b: 60 and
Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1985: 258; unavailable names.]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Phalacromyrmecini as junior synonym of Dacetini: Baroni Urbani &amp;
De Andrade, 1994: 10; Baroni Urbani &amp; De Andrade, 2007: 81.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Phalacromyrmecini tribe of Myrmicinae: Dlussky &amp; Fedoseeva,
1988: 80; Hölldobler &amp; Wilson, 1990: 16; Bolton, 1994: 106; Bolton, 1995b:
14; Bolton, 1998: 72. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genera of
Phalacromyrmecini</span></b><span lang=EN-GB>: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Ishakidris, Phalacromyrmex, Pilotrochus</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history</span></b></p>

lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe <span

lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus of <span
style='color:red'>Cataulacini<o:p></o:p></span></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cataulacus</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Smith, F. 1853: 225.

by subsequent designation of Bingham, 1903: 120.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cataulacus</span></i><span

81.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i

414.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cataulacus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Cryptoceridae: Smith, F. 1862a: 49; Smith, F. 1871a: 334; Smith,
F. 1876d: 609.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cataulacus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae: Mayr, 1865: 26 [Myrmicidae]; Dalla Torre, 1893: 137.
</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cataulacus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Dacetini: Forel, 1892d: 344; Forel, 1893a: 164.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cataulacus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Cryptoceridae, Cataulacinae: Ashmead, 1905b: 384.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cataulacus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Cataulacini: Emery, 1895j: 771; Wheeler, W.M. 1910g:
142; Emery, 1914a: 42; Forel, 1917: 246; Arnold, 1917: 386; Wheeler, W.M.
1922a: 665; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Junior synonym of <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>CATAULACUS<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Otomyrmex</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Forel, 1891b: 147 [as
subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cataulacus</i>].
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cataulacus oberthueri</i>,
by monotypy. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Otomyrmex</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cataulacus</i>:
Forel, 1891b: 147; Dalla Torre, 1893: 137; Forel, 1917: 246; Wheeler, W.M.
1910g: 142; Emery, 1924d: 299.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Otomyrmex</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cataulacus</i>:
Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 665 (in text); Brown, 1973b: 183 [provisional]; Bolton,
1974a: 7.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'><span style='color:red'>Cataulacus</span></i> references</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB>: see above.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe <span
style='color:red'>CEPHALOTINI</span> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cephalotini</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Smith, M.R. 1949c: 19. Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Cephalotes</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cephalotini as tribe of Myrmicinae: Smith, M.R. 1949c: 19; Kempf,
1951: 11; Kempf, 1952: 1; Kempf, 1958a: 1; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Junior synonym of <span
style='color:red'>CEPHALOTINI<o:p></o:p></span></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cryptoceridae</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Smith, F. 1853: 214. Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Cryptocerus</i> (junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cephalotes</i>).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cryptoceridae as group of Myrmicidae: Smith, F. 1853: 214. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cryptoceridae as subfamily of Poneridae: Smith, F. 1858b: 187.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cryptoceridae as family: Smith, F. 1860a: 75; Smith, F. 1862a: 49;
Smith, F. 1871a: 334; Ashmead, 1905b: 383.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cryptoceridae as subfamily of Formicidae: Smith, F. 1857a: 79;
Smith, F. 1862b: 35; Smith, F. 1862d: 408; Smith, F. 1867: 523.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cryptoceridae as group of Myrmicinae: Emery, 1877a: 72.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cryptoceridae as junior synonym of Myrmicinae: Emery &amp; Forel,
1879a: 456.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cryptoceridae as tribe or subfamily of Myrmicidae: Forel, 1891b: 143
[Cryptocerini]; Emery, 1894g: 383 [Cryptocerinae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cryptoceridae as tribe of Myrmicinae: Forel, 1892d: 344
[Cryptocerini]; Forel, 1893a: 164 [Cryptocerii]; Forel, 1895b: 132
[Cryptocerii]; Emery, 1895j: 763 [Cryptocerii]; Forel, 1899c: 43 [Cryptocerii];
Wheeler, W.M. 1910g: 141 [Cryptocerii]; Forel, 1892d: 344 [Cryptocerini];
Emery, 1914a: 39 [Cryptocerini]; Emery, 1915i: 192 [Cryptocerini]; Wheeler,
W.M. 1915e: 491 [Cryptoceriini (in text)]; Forel, 1917: 246 [Cryptocerini];
Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 657 [Cryptocerini]; Emery, 1924d: 299 [Cryptocerini]; all
subsequent authors to the following; Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1976b: 59
[Cryptocerini]; Dlussky &amp; Fedoseeva, 1988: 79 [Cryptocerini (anachronism)].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cryptoceridae as junior synonym of Cephalotini: Smith, M.R. 1949c:
18; Kempf, 1951: 11; all subsequent authors except for the above anachronisms.
[Cephalotini retains priority over Cryptoceridae under Article 40.2 of the
International Code of Zoological Nomenclature (4th Edition), 1999: 46.]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genera of Cephalotini</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB>: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cephalotes, Procryptocerus</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe <span
style='color:red'>Cephalotini</span> references <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Emery, 1895j:
771 (diagnosis); Wheeler, W.M. 1910g: 141 (diagnosis); Emery, 1914a: 39, 42
(diagnosis (in key), synoptic classification); Forel, 1917: 246 (synoptic
classification); Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 665 (genera key); Emery, 1924d: 299
(diagnosis, genera key, catalogue); Kempf, 1951: 11 (revision of tribe, genera
key); Kempf, 1958a: 4 (Argentina fauna); Kempf, 1973c: 461 (genera); Wheeler,
G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1976b: 59 (larvae, review &amp; synthesis); Kugler, C.
1978a: 473 (sting structure); Hölldobler &amp; Wilson, 1990: 16 (synoptic
classification); Brandão, 1991: 391 (Neotropical fauna, synoptic
classification); Bolton, 1994: 105 (synoptic classification); Bolton, 1995a:
1040 (census); Bolton, 1995b: 10 (catalogue); De Andrade &amp; Baroni Urbani,
1999: 1 (diagnosis, review of tribe, revision of genera); Bolton, 2003: 56, 194
(diagnosis, synopsis).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genera of <span
style='color:red'>Cephalotini<o:p></o:p></span></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'><span style='color:red'>CEPHALOTES</span></i> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cephalotes</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Latreille, 1802a: 357.
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica atrata</i>, by
monotypy. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>[Type-species not <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica
cephalotes</i>, unjustified subsequent designation by Wheeler, W.M. 1911f: 160;
corrected by Wheeler, W.M. 1913a: 78.]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cephalotes</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Cryptocerini: Emery, 1914a: 42; Forel, 1917: 246;
Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 665; Emery, 1924d: 303; all subsequent authors to 1949,
and Dlussky &amp; Fedoseeva, 1988: 79 (anachronism).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cephalotes</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Cephalotini: Smith, M.R. 1949c: 19; Kempf, 1951:
105; all subsequent authors except the above.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cephalotes</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cryptocerus</i>:
Fabricius, 1804: 419.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;</span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Junior synonyms of <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:red'>CEPHALOTES<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Cryptocerus</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Latreille, 1803: 311.
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica atrata</i>, by
subsequent designation of Latreille, 1810: 437. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>[Type-species not <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cryptocerus
umbraculatus</i>, unjustified subsequent designation by Emery, 1914c: 38,
repeated in Emery, 1924d: 305.] </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicites: Lepeletier de Saint-Fargeau, 1835: 170.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicidae, Cryptoceridae: Smith, F. 1853: 214; Emery, 1877a:
81.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Poneridae, Cryptoceridae: Smith, F. 1858b: 187.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Cryptoceridae: Smith, F. 1876d: 605.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Cryptoceridae, Cryptocerinae: Ashmead, 1905b: 384.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae: Mayr, 1865: 25 [Myrmicidae]; Mayr, 1866b: 907
[Myrmicidae]; Dalla Torre, 1893: 140. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Cryptocerini: Forel, 1892d: 345; Forel, 1893a: 164;
Forel, 1895b: 133; Emery, 1895j: 771; Forel, 1899c: 48; Wheeler, W.M. 1910g:
141; Emery, 1914a: 42; Forel, 1917: 246; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 665; Emery,
1924d: 305; Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1976b: 59.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Cryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cephalotes</i>:
Wheeler, W.M. 1913a: 78; Donisthorpe, 1943f: 635; Smith, M.R. 1949c: 19; Kempf,
1951: 105; all subsequent authors except the above. [<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Cephalotes</i> and <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cryptocerus</i>
share the same type-species, synonymy is therefore absolute.] </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>[<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:purple'>Cryptocephalus</span></i>
Lowne, 1865b: 336, incorrect subsequent spelling of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Cryptocerus</i> in the combination <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cryptocephalus
pubescens</i>; current combination <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Meranoplus
pubescens</i>: Bolton, 1981a: 47.]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Zacryptocerus</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Wheeler, W.M. 1911f:
175 (see also footnote). Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cryptocerus
clypeatus</i>, by original designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>[<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Zacryptocerus</i> Ashmead,
1905b: 384, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>nomen nudum</i>. (Based on a
non-existent type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cryptocerus
multistrigus</i>, <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>nomen nudum</i>,
attributed to Smith, F.).]<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Zacryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Cryptocerini: Forel, 1917: 246; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a:
665; Emery, 1924d: 304; all subsequent authors except the following; Dlussky
&amp; Fedoseeva, 1988: 79 (anachronism).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Zacryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Cephalotini: Kempf, 1951: 133; all subsequent
authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Zacryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cephalotes</i>:
De Andrade &amp; Baroni Urbani, 1999: 59.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Paracryptocerus</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Emery, 1915i: 192
[as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cryptocerus</i>].
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cryptocerus spinosus</i>,
by original designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Paracryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Cryptocerini: Forel, 1917: 246; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a:
665; Emery, 1924d: 306; Donisthorpe, 1943f: 680.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Paracryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Cephalotini: Smith, M.R. 1949c: 20; Kempf, 1951:
153; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Paracryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cryptocerus</i>:
Emery, 1915i: 192; Forel, 1917: 246; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 665; Emery, 1924d:
306.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Paracryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as genus: Smith, M.R. 1949c: 20; Kempf, 1951: 153; Kempf, 1972a:
175. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Paracryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Zacryptocerus</i>:
Kempf, 1973c: 460; Smith, D.R. 1979: 1402.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Hypocryptocerus</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Wheeler, W.M. 1920:
53 [as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cryptocerus</i>].
Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica haemorrhoidalis</i>,
by original designation. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Hypocryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Cryptocerini: Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 665; Wheeler,
W.M. 1936b: 200; Donisthorpe, 1943f: 652.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Hypocryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Cephalotini: Kempf, 1951: 143.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Hypocryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cryptocerus</i>:
Wheeler, W.M. 1920: 53; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 665.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Hypocryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as genus: Wheeler, W.M. 1936b: 200; Kempf, 1951: 143; Kempf, 1972a:
120.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Hypocryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as junior synonym of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Zacryptocerus</i>:
Kempf, 1973c: 460; Smith, D.R. 1979: 1402.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

[as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Cryptocerus</i>]. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

original designation.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span

by original designation.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span

(footnote). Type-species: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Meranoplus
striatus</i>, by subsequent designation of Wheeler, W.M. 1911f: 171. </span></p>

style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Procryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Cryptoceridae, Cryptocerinae: Ashmead, 1905b: 384.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i

79 (anachronism).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Procryptocerus</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Cephalotini: Kempf, 1951: 14; all subsequent authors
except anachronism above.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:

(Colombia + Panama (= New Grenada) species key (as <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Cataulacus</i>)); Dalla Torre, 1893: 139 (catalogue); Emery, 1924d: 300
(diagnosis, catalogue); Kempf, 1951: 15 (diagnosis, all species revision, key);

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe <span
style='color:red'>ATTINI</span> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Attidae</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB> Smith, F. 1858b: 161. Type-genus: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Atta</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Attini as subfamily of Formicidae: Smith, F. 1858b: 161 [Attidae];
Smith, F. 1862b: 34 [Attidae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Attini as family: Smith, F. 1861b: 48 [Attidae]; Smith, F. 1863: 21
[Attidae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Attini as group of Myrmicidae: Emery, 1877a: 72 [Attidae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Attini as junior synonym of Myrmicidae: Emery &amp; Forel, 1879a:
457 [Attidae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Attini as subfamily of Myrmicidae: Emery, 1894g: 385 [Attinae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Attini as tribe of Myrmicidae: Forel, 1891b: 143.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Attini as subfamily of Cryptoceridae: Ashmead, 1905b: 383<span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>[Attinae].</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Attini as tribe of Myrmicinae: Forel, 1892d: 344; Forel, 1893a: 163
[Attii]; Forel, 1895b: 137 [Attii]; Emery, 1895j: 770 [Attii]; Forel, 1899c: 30
[Attii]; Wheeler, W.M. 1910g: 141 [Attii]; Emery, 1913b: 251; Emery, 1914a: 39;
Forel, 1917: 247; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 658; Emery, 1924d: 330; all subsequent
authors. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genera of Attini</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB>: <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Acromyrmex, Apterostigma,
Atta, Cyphomyrmex, Kalathomyrmex, Mycetagroicus, Mycetarotes, Mycetophylax,
Mycetosoritis, Mycocepurus, Myrmicocrypta, Paramycetophylax, Pseudoatta,
Sericomyrmex, Trachymyrmex</i>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB>Ichnotaxon: *<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='color:green'>Attaichnus</span></i>. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Tribe <span
style='color:red'>Attini</span> references <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB>Emery, 1895j:
770 (diagnosis); Wheeler, W.M. 1907c: 669 (North America fauna); Wheeler, W.M.
1910g: 141 (diagnosis); Emery, 1912b: 101 (phylogeny); Emery, 1913b: 251
(synoptic classification); Emery, 1914a: 39, 42 (diagnosis (in key), synoptic
classification); Gallardo, 1916d: 318 (Argentina genera, key); Forel, 1917: 247
(synoptic classification); Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 668 (genera key); Emery, 1924d:
330 (diagnosis, genera key, catalogue); Kusnezov, 1964: 147 (phylogeny);
Wheeler, G.C. &amp; Wheeler, J. 1976b: 60 (larvae, review &amp; synthesis);
Kugler, C. 1978a: 477 (sting structure); Weber, 1982: 255 (synopsis); Dlussky
&amp; Fedoseeva, 1988: 79 (synoptic classification); Hölldobler &amp; Wilson,
1990: 16 (synoptic classification); Brandão, 1991: 392 (Neotropical fauna,
synoptic classification); Bolton, 1994: 105 (synoptic classification); Bolton,
1995a: 1040 (census); Bolton, 1995b: 9 (catalogue); Schultz &amp; Meier, 1995:
337 (phylogeny, larvae); Lattke, 1999: 2 (phylogeny, partial); Brandão &amp;
Mayhé-Nunes, 2001: 661 (monophyly); Bolton, 2003: 56, 196 (diagnosis,
synopsis); Fernández, 2003d: 310 (Neotropical genera); Klingenberg &amp;

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genera of <span
style='color:red'>Attini<o:p></o:p></span></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Genus <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'><span style='color:red'>ACROMYRMEX</span></i> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
lang=EN-GB>Acromyrmex</span></i></b><span lang=EN-GB> Mayr, 1865: 83 [as
subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Atta</i>]. Type-species: <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Formica hystrix</i>, by monotypy. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Taxonomic history</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Acromyrmex</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Cryptoceridae, Attinae: Ashmead, 1905b: 384.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Acromyrmex</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> in Myrmicinae, Attini: Emery, 1895j: 770; Emery, 1913b: 251; Emery,
1914a: 42; Forel, 1917: 247; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 669; Emery, 1924d: 347; all
subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Acromyrmex</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as subgenus of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Atta</i>:
Mayr, 1865: 83; Forel, 1885a: 354; Dalla Torre, 1893: 151; Forel, 1893a: 163;
Emery, 1895j: 770; Forel, 1899c: 30; Emery, 1905c: 39; Wheeler, W.M. 1907c:
670; Wheeler, W.M. 1910g: 141; Wheeler, W.M. 1922a: 669.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Acromyrmex</span></i><span
lang=EN-GB> as genus: Emery, 1913b: 251; Forel, 1917: 247; Emery, 1924d: 347;
Santschi, 1925a: 355; all subsequent authors.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB>Subgenera of <i

include the nominal plus the following.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><span
lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in'><b

(MOELLERIUS)</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
